loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tools.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca tiene 64 años de edad vive junto a su menor hijo en el distrito de Zaña, su población se dedica al comercio de todo tipo y agricultura, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella nos explica que se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir su taller está ubicado en su domicilio, con la ayuda de su hijo crían animales menores patos, gallinas y cuyes que luego de engordarlos los ofrecen en el mercado de la zona.

Son una familia unida, Francisca ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 500 nuevos soles para la compra de materiales de confección telas, hilos y una segunda parte para alimentos balanceados para engorde de animales y de esta manera tener una mejor producción para ofrecerlos a sus clientes, generándole ingresos adicionales para su familia.
texts.en:
Francisca is 64 years old. She lives together with her youngest son in the district of Zaña. Its residents work in all types of business and in agriculture. It is two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on the northern coast of Perú.

She explains to us that she works sewing garments. Her shop is located in her house. With the help of her son, they raise young animals – ducks, hens, and guinea pigs – that they sell in the area’s market after fattening them.

They are a united family. Francisca has requested a loan of 2500 nuevos soles for the purchase of tailoring materials like fabric and thread, and a second part for balanced feed for fattening her animals, and in this way have better production to offer her clients, generating additional income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase tailoring materials: thread and fabric; and balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Carlos Ovidio

texts.es: Carlos de 36 años de edad habita en condiciones muy humildes junto a su esposa y sus 4 hijos de 17 años, 15 años, 13 años y 8 años de edad. Para Carlos lo más importante es que sus hijos tengan mejores oportunidades de vida a las que él y su esposa han tenido y es por eso que trabaja muy duro como albañil en diferentes zonas de su localidad.  Con sus ingresos y los de su esposa quien trabaja como vendedora de pan dulce mantienen la economía de su casa y poco a poco van sacando adelante a sus hijos. Su casa es muy pequeña y ya no es cómoda para toda la familia por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un cuarto para su hijo mayor. Con el crédito comprará lámina, ladrillo, arena, y cemento. Expresa tener la capacidad para cancelar el crédito.
texts.en:
Carlos, 36, lives in humble conditions with his wife and four children aged 17, 15, 13 and 8.  The most important thing for Carlos is that his children have better opportunities in life than he and his wife have had.  For this reason, he works very hard as a builder in different areas of his town.  With this income, together with his wife’s, who works as a sweet bread seller, they keep the house going and little by little they provide for their children.

Their house is very small and is no longer comfortable for all the family, so they are asking for a loan from FUSAI to be able to build a bedroom for the eldest brother.  With the loan, he will buy sheets of material, bricks, sand and cement.  He stresses that he has the capability to pay off the loan.

loans.use: to buy sheets of material, bricks, sand and cement to build a room.

loans.name: Miguel Etasnislado

texts.es: El señor Miguel, agricultor todo su vida, ademas de trabajar la tierra es labora como Guarda de Seguridad, su compañera de vida trabaja como domestica en una casa privada, entre los dos luchan dia a dia por mejorar sus condiciones de vida, actualmente el señor Miguel necesita dar mantenimiento a su cultivo de Piña, ya que asi aprovecharia las lluvias para que su cosecha este limpia de plagas, comprara: Urea, Triple, Completo 20-60-20, Divion, Gesepex, etc. el espera contar siempre con el apoyo de Afodenic y Fondos Kiva, ya que gracias a ellos su economia a mejorado un poco.
texts.en:
Miguel has been a farmer all his life, but apart from this job, he is also a security guard.  His partner works as a maid in a house.  Between the two, they strive each day to improve their situation.  At the moment, Miguel needs to treat his pineapple crop, so he can make the most of the rain and keep his harvest free of pests.  He will buy urea, fertilizers, herbicides and other agricultural supplies.  

He hopes to always be able to count on Afodenic and Kiva funds, given that thanks to their help, he has improved his financial situation a little.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Pastora

texts.es:
Pastora tiene 70 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en Oyotun, una comunidad que se dedica al cultivo de algodón, arroz, maíz y comercio de animales menores a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella nos explica que apoya a su esposo con el sostenimiento de su hogar, dedicándose a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior a su domicilio, su esposo se dedica a labores agrícolas en la zona.

Pastora ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para comprar aves de corral y ofrecerlos en los caseríos aledaños a su comunidad y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Pastora is 70 and lives with her family in Oyotun, a small community which is two hours away from Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru.  In this area, people typically work growing cotton, rice, corn and selling small farm animals.

She tells us that she helps her husband with the household expenses by raising and selling farm animals, which she keeps at the back of her house.  Her husband works in agriculture.

Pastora has asked for a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles to buy poultry which she can sell in the small villages nearby and generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy poultry for farming

loans.name: Abdurasul

texts.ru:
Абдурасулу из города Худжанд 28 лет. Он женат, но детей еще не имеет. Абдурасул владеет маленьким цехом по выпечке хлеба. Цех открылся 4 года назад. Для Абдурасула он приносит не большой доход. Потому что он только начинает развивать свой бизнес. Абдурасул не останавливается на достигнутом и идет вперед. Он хочет взять кредит на сумму 3000$ чтобы купить большую духовку для выпечки кондитерских изделий. 
    Когда он приобретет духовку, соответственно работы тоже будет больше. Ему будет помогать жена. Если ранее Абдурасул работал один, то в будущем они будут работать вместе. Абдурасул надеется, что он сделал правильный выбор и в будущем он сможет успешно развивать свой малый бизнес.
texts.en: Abdurasul is from Khujand.  He is 28 years old and married, but he does not yet have children.  Abdurasul runs a small bakery which opened four years ago and brings him a small income.  Since he has just started to increase his business, Abdurasul will keep moving forward.  He wants to get a loan of $3,000 to buy a big oven in which to make his baked goods.  When he gets the oven, his workload will increase.  His wife will help him; if Abdurasul worked alone before, then they will work together in the future.  He hopes that he has made the right choice and in the future he will be able to successfully increase his small business.

loans.use: to buy a stove for baking pastries

loans.name: Holmurod

texts.ru: Холмуроду 46 лет. Он живет и работает в селе Яванского района. Основным видом деятельности для Холмурода и жителей Явана является скотоводство и растениеводство. Холмурод такими деятельностями занимается очень давно. Он проживает и кормит свою семью за счет своей земли и скотов. Холмурод успешно занимается выращиванием коров и посевом сельскохозяйственных культур в течение 10 лет. В Таджикистане осень проходит почти не заметно, лето задерживается на долгое время и сразу приходят холода. Несмотря на то что на данный момент в Яване по летнему тепло, холода остались не за горами. Холмурод берет кредит, чтобы закупить минеральные удобрения, обработать землю и подготовить к посеву.
texts.en: Holmurod is 46 years old.  He lives and works in a village in the Yavan region of Tajikistan.  Holmurod, along with most of people living in Yavan, raises livestock and grows crops for a living, and has been at it for quite some time.  He lives off the land, feeding himself and his family through the crops he grows and the animals he raises.  Holmurod has successfully been engaged in the farming and animal husbandry for 10 years.  Autumn in Tajikistan goes by almost unnoticed; the summer weather does not end with summer, and the winter cold sets in not long thereafter.  At the moment, Holmurod is seeking a loan to stock up on mineral fertilizers to prepare the soil for sowing.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers to prepare the soil for sowing

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru: Фарход проживает в Б.Гафуровском районе города Худжанд. Ему 36 лет. Он женат и имеет двух сыновей и дочь. Жена Фархода работает в стеклотарном заводе. Сам Фарход, чтобы обеспечивать семью работает на двух работах не жалея сил, поскольку дети растут и семейные раходы тоже увеличиваются. Фарход в течение 15 лет работает в экологическом центре. Одновременно последние два года он занимается купле-продажей рыбы. Его старший сын в этом году окончил среднюю школу и поступил в Худжандский Государственный Университет факультет "Финансы и кредит". А младший сын и дочь еще учатся в школе. Фарходу в данный момент необходимо оплатить за обучения сына в университете по контракту. Это большая сумма для их семьи и по причине нехватки финансов он решил обратиться за кредитом. Фарход очень хочет, чтобы его сын получил высшее финансовое образование и развивался в этом направлении, так как у его сына хорошие аналитические способности, которые необходимо развивать.
texts.en:
Farhod, age 36, lives in the Ghafurov district of the city of Khujand.   He is married and the father of two sons and a daughter.  His wife works for a glass factory. With his children growing up and family expenses increasing, Farhod himself holds two jobs and spares no effort  to provide for his family. 

Farhod has been working at the Ecology Center for the past 15 years.  At the same time, he has been buying and selling fish for the past two years.  This year, his oldest son graduated from high school and enrolled at the "Finance and Credit" School of the Khujand State University.  His youngest son and daughter are still in school.  

Farhod currently needs to pay his son's tuition fees at the University, which represent a large amount of money for the family.  Since he doesn't have the necessary funds, he has decided to apply for a loan.  Farhod really wants his son to get a higher education in the field of finance and to pursue his studies in this direction, as he has good analytic skills which should be developed.

loans.use: to pay for his son's higher education costs.

loans.name: Jarkynay

texts.ru: Жаркынай 25 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Жаркынай - неоконченное-высшее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Жаркынай занимается полеводством, стартовав 7 лет назад, с 6,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Жаркынай, на сегодняшний день имеется: 5,99 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает картофель, сеет зерновые культуры и эспарцет для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жаркынай обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян картофеля элитного сорта, семян ячменя для посевных работ. Жаркынай хочет заняться дополнительно животноводством и доходы от кредита Жаркынай планирует вложить в покупку домашней скотины, а также планирует накопить средства на строительство нового дома.
texts.en:
Jarkynay is 25 years old, married, and raising two children with her husband. She did not complete her higher education degree.  She is now involved in agriculture, an activity which provides her family with its main source of income. She started in this business seven years ago with a capital of 6,000 som (KGS.

Thanks to Jarkynay's hard work, her farming business now comprises 5.99 hectares of land on which she grows potatoes annually and sows crops and sainfoin for the family's consumption and also for resale. She makes a monthly income of 12,000 som (KGS).

In order to further develop her farming business, Jarkynay has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" and requested a loan of 80,000 som (KGS). She will use this loan to buy a high-end variety of potato seeds as well as barley seeds for sowing. 

Jarkinay plans to get involved in animal husbandry as well and re-invest some of her profits back into her business by purchasing livestock. She is also planning to save enough money to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy a high-end variety of potato seeds as well as some barley seeds for sowing.

loans.name: Saikal

texts.ru: Сайкал 34 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Сайкал - высшее образование, работает преподавателем в местной школе. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Сайкал занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 14 лет назад, с покупки скота на 15,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Сайкал, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 2 теленка, 6 овец, а также имеет 10,0 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает клевер и пшеницу. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Сайкал обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Сайкал планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку автомашины.
texts.en: Saikal is 34 years old, married and raising three children together with her husband. Saikal has a higher education and works as a teacher at a local school. To provide additional income for her family, Saikal is involved in animal husbandry and farming, having started 14 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 15,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Saikal's hard work, today her business contains 1 dairy cow, 2 calves, 6 sheep and also 10 hectares of land, where she annually grows clover and wheat. The monthly income amounts to 5,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Saikal requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy a cow in order to increase livestock headcount. Saikal plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Salyimabubu

texts.ru: Салыймабубу 39 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Салыймабубу - средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Салыймабубу занимается животноводством, стартовав 5 лет назад, с покупки скота на 50,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Салыймабубу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 25 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Салыймабубу обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Салыймабубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство незавершенного дома.
texts.en: Salyimabubu is 39 years old, married, and has two children with her spouse. She has a vocational high school education. The sole source of income for the family is Salyimabubu's business raising animals. She started five years ago by buying 50,000 som (KGS) worth of livestock. Thanks to her tireless work, she currently owns two milk cows and 25 sheep. Her monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS). With the goal of further developing her business, Salyimabubu asked the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a 120,000 som (KGS) loan for the purchase of cows to expand her herd. Salyimabubu plans to invest profit earned from use of the loan into further expanding the number of livestock she owns, and she also plans to save money to finish building a house.

loans.use: to purchase cows to expand her herd

loans.name: Natiq

texts.en:
Natiq is a 33-year-old married person. Natiq is a hardworking and well known grocer. In his grocery store, he provides his neighborhood with canned foods, snacks, dairy products, juices, and drinks. He has long experience in this field and has gained his experience through working with his father ever since he was a young man.

He wants to solve some problems in his store and for that he needs a loan 900 AZN. He will use this loan to buy a new motor generator and to install some new shelves in his grocery store. Natiq believes that this loan will help him a lot in keeping his dairy products fresh and will satisfy his customers, thus he will gain a better reputation and grow bigger in the market.

loans.use: to install some new shelves in his grocery store

loans.name: Lentush

texts.en:
Lentush lives in the village of Achajur, which is in the Tavush region.  He is 29 years old and he lives with his wife and two children (a girl and a boy).  His parents and his brother temporally live and work in the Russian Federation and they greatly help Lentush’s family overcome their family financial problems.  

Lentush is engaged in farming and it brings good income to his small family.  On his farm he breeds cows, calves and chickens.  He sells his farm products, which are milk and eggs, to his village food market. 

Lentush has some new plans connected with his farming and he is requesting a loan of 1,100,000 AMD in order to buy five horses.  With Nor Horizon, he has previously repaid three loans, always making his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy five horses which will help him in his farming.

loans.name: Akbar

texts.en:
Akbar is a first-year student at AUCA in the department of Economics. Here is his story.

“AUCA has everything I have been looking for in a university. Even though my high school career has been one I’ve struggled through, I am confident I can continue my education successfully at AUCA. AUCA’s economics program is extremely reputable. I am sure that the education I receive at AUCA will be unrivaled. With the combination of AUCA’s reputable economics program I will become a high qualified economist. With the large amount of resources at my disposal, the inspiration student body and community and a highly ranked economics program, AUCA is my ideal school to jumpstart my career in economics and also improve my English. 

My teacher has told me that AUCA was rated as top university, a very impressive accomplishment considering the amount of all universities in Kyrgyzstan. AUCA’s prestigious economics program combined with all the conditions to study creates an ideal package I’ve been searching for in a prospective university. AUCA is a perfect place for me to continue my career goals and follow my economic endeavors.  Another thing I would like to mention is that AUCA gives many opportunities to all its students. The loan opportunity is among those opportunities. I would like to take this opportunity to apply for a Kiva loan, which is a great chance to be able to cover my tuition fees.”

loans.use: to pay for his higher education.

loans.name: Nurullo

texts.en:
Nurullo is a kind and responsible father and grandfather. He is 56 years old. He has two children and several grandchildren and has a big and happy family. Nurullo's wife is a housewife and helps with bringing up the grandchildren. Nurullo himself is engaged in the purchase, fattening and sales of livestock. He has been engaged in this business for a long time. In the summer season Nurullo brings his livestock to the pasture, and closer to winter, he brings them home for fattening . When his cattle are out on pasture Nurullo works in the field where he grows crops. Some extra income Nurullo receives from his son, who sends him money from Russia.

Nurullo has been a very long-term client of MDO " Arvand " and has been taking loans for several years for his business. Nurullo once again applied for a loan for the growth of its business. He plans to buy additional cattle and to increase his livestock . Nurullo expresses his gratitude to Kiva and Arvand for support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials like cement to use for her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more sewing materials for resale

loans.name: Matlubakhon

texts.ru: Матлубахон 56 лет, воспитывает 3 детей. После смерти супруга, Матлубахон очень долго не могла пережить утрату близкого человека. Нужно было воспитывать и ставить на ноги детей и Матлубахон решила взять хозяйство и материальную ответственность в свои руки.  У Матлубахон - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Матлубахон занимается животноводством, стартовав 35 лет назад, с покупки скота на 3,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Матлубахон, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы и 5 овец, а также имеет земельный надел размером 0,54 ГА, на котором выращивает картофель, хлопок и овощи. Ежемесячный доход составляет 7,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Матлубахон обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Матлубахон планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и намерена собрать средства на строительство нового помещения для скота.
texts.en:
Matlubakhon is 56 years old and she raises three children.  It took her a very long time to recover from the death of her beloved husband.  But she had to raise and put her children back on their feet, so she decided to take responsibility for the business and material circumstances and she took the situation in her own hands.  Matlubakhon has a secondary education and she is involved in animal husbandry, an activity which provides her family with its main source of income. She started in this business 35 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 3,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, she now owns two dairy cows and 5 sheep, and she cultivates 0.54 hectare (1.33 acre) of land on which she grows potatoes, cotton and vegetables. She makes a monthly income of 7,000 som (KGS).

In order to further develop her farming business, Matlubakhon has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" and requested a loan of 100,000 som (KGS). She will use this loan to buy some cows which she will fatten and then resell at a higher price at the market.

She plans to re-invest the profits from this loan back into her business by purchasing additional livestock. She is also planning to save enough money for the construction of a new building in which she will keep her livestock.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de 20 membres dynamiques et solidaires qui font comme activités le commerce et l'embouche.
Fatou, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 65 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants dont 02 garçons. Son activité principale est le commerce d'oseille et de pain de singe. Elle fait cette activité depuis qu'elle est majeure. Elle fait comme activité parallèle l'embouche ovine. 
Elle achète 04 bassines d'oseilles à 3000 F l'unité qu'elle va revendre à 5000 F et 03 bassines de pain de singe à 2500 F l'unité qu'elle revend à 4500 F. Elle achète aussi un mouton à 30 000 F qu'elle élève et au bout de 05 mois le revendre à 50 000 F.
Avec les bénéfices qu'elle génère, elle renforce son épargne et entretien ses petits enfants.
texts.en:
This group is composed of 20 dynamic and interdependent members, who are active in retail commerce and the fattening of livestock.

Fatou, standing to the right of the photo and raising her hand is 65 years old. She is married and the mother of seven children including two boys.

Her main activity is the trade of sorrel and "pain de singe" (fruit of the baobab tree). She has been conducting this activity since she became an adult. As a parallel activity she fattens sheep.

She buys four basins of sorrel at 3,000 francs a unit that she resells at 5,000 francs, and three basins of baobab fruit at 2,500 francs a unit she resells at 4,500 francs. She also buys a sheep for 30,000 francs she then raises and resells after five months for 50,000 francs.

With the profits she generates, she bolsters her savings and supports her grandchildren.

loans.use: Buy sorrel and "pain de singe" (fruit of the baobab tree)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy metal for resale

loans.name: Ayaovi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de pagnes depuis 2005, madame Ayaovi pour mieux répondre aux besoins des clients, fait sa première demande à WAGES pour acheter plus de marchandises. Mariée, elle a 02 enfants(06ans et 03 mois). Le profit l'aidera à assurer une bonne scolarisation à ses derniers et ouvrir une boutique de pagnes.
texts.en:
A retailer of pagnes (colorful West-African fabric) since 2005, Ms. Ayaovi is requesting a first loan from WAGES, to buy more goods so she can better meet the needs of her customers.

She is married and has two children (six years and three months old). The profits will help ensure a good schooling for her children and enable her to open a pagnes shop.

loans.use: buy pagnes (colorful West-African fabric)

loans.name: Intumwa Group

texts.fr:
Pascaline fait partie du groupe  Intumwa et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 27 ans et est mariée à Justin. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants  âgés de 1 à 8 ans, 2 étudient.
Elle a sous sa charge 2 enfants , membres de sa famille élargie, qui étudient.

Elle est coiffeuse depuis 5 ans  et vend des habits. 

Elle est à son deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’habits à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle  voudrait ouvrir une boutique  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Pascaline is part of the Intumwa group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 27 years old and is married to Justin. Together they have three children aged one to eight years, of whom two attend school. She has two other children under her care, members of her extended family, who attend school.

She has been a hairdresser for the past five years, and also sells clothing.

This is her second credit loan from Turame. With the KIVA loan she obtains, she will increase her working capital and buy a lot of clothes for resale, to earn more.

In coming years, she wants to open a shop and see to her children's education.

loans.use: increase her working capital and buy a lot of clothes for resale, to earn more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Lonlongno-Djokoto Group

texts.fr: Mr Komlan âgé de 80ans est cultivateur de profession. Marié, il a 06 enfants tous scolarisés. En plus de son activité champêtre, il prépare de la boisson alcoolisée locale appelé SODABI. Il a démarré en 2003 et sollicite son second crédit pour acheter des engrais pour son activité agricole. Il a été nommé pour être le responsable du groupement constitué de femmes et d'hommes. Ils sont soient dans le stockage des céréales, le fumage des poissons, le commerce. Ils espèrent avec le profit disposer de plus de réserves et assurer les besoins alimentaires de la famille.
texts.en:
Mr Komlan is 80 years old and a farmer by profession. He is married with six children, all in school.

In addition to his agricultural work, he prepares a local alcoholic beverage called Sodabi. He began in 2003 and is requesting his second loan to buy fertilizer for his agricultural activity.

He was appointed to be the head of the group consisting of men and women. They are in the business of storing grain, smoking fish, or retail trading. 

They hope that with the profits they will have more stock and be able to meet family needs.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and raw materials

loans.name: Maria Benedicta

texts.es:
María Benedicta tiene 58 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Salitral, una comunidad conocida por la venta de chicha de jora y ceviche, su población se dedica al comercio y agricultura, que pertenece a Morropon, a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su familia se dedican a la venta de chicha de jora y cerveza, su negocio está ubicado en su domicilio, Ella ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 500 nuevos soles para comprar abarrotes y de esta manera hacer crecer su negocio lo que le generara mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
María Benedicta, 58, lives with her husband in the district of Salitral, a community known for selling "chicha de jora" (corn-based drink) and "ceviche" (seafood dish).  The local people are involved in commerce and agriculture in Morropon which is two hours from the city of Piura along the northern coast of Peru.

María Benedicta and her family work from home selling chicha de jora and beer.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 3,500 PEN to buy grocieries and expand her business in an aim to generate more income for the family.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her business.

loans.name: Amparo Judith

texts.es:
Amparo vive e la ciudad de imperial trabaja como empleada en una empresa de transportes de su ciudad, hace un año; amparo con el fruto de su trabajo puede sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos de 9 y 2 años de edad, amparo cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable.

Amparo esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar materiales de construcción para poder colocar piso en su vivienda ya que actualmente es de tierra de esta manera podrá mejorar su calidad de vida de su familia y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Darle una profesión a a sus hijas”.
texts.en:
Amparo lives in the city of Imperial and has worked at a transport company there for a year.  With her income she is able to provide for her two children, ages nine and two.  She believes work is going well for her because she is very responsible.

Amparo is grateful to Kiva lenders for the help she is receiving so she can buy construction materials to put down flooring in her home.  It is now a dirt floor so the improvement will give her family more quality of life.  This will encourage her to continue striving toward her goal of "giving her children a professional career".

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Francisco David

texts.es: Francisco de 26 años de edad vive en casa propia junto a su esposa y su pequeño hijo recién nacido. Francisco trabaja como empleado de una constructora cerca de su localidad y con los ingresos que percibe lleva el sustento a su casa. Desea mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda ya que con el tiempo el techo del corredor y la cocina se ha deteriorado y es necesario hacer el cambio lo antes posible. También, desea hacer un muro de retención para dar mayor seguridad a su vivienda. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera, arena, ladrillo y cemento; ya que no cuenta con el capital para hacer el desembolso. Francisco será quien realizará los trabajos por lo que se ahorrará la mano de obra.
texts.en:
Francisco, 26, lives with his wife and his newborn son. Francisco works for a construction company close to where he lives. With the income he receives, he brings food to his family’s table. 

He wants to make some home improvements. With time, the roof of his front porch and of his kitchen has deteriorated, so it needs to be replaced as soon as possible. He is also planning to build a retaining wall in order to make his house safer. This is why he is requesting a loan at FUSAI; he does not have the money to purchase the materials. He will buy galvanized sheets, wood, sand, brick and cement. Francisco will do the work himself, which will save him the cost of the labor.

loans.use: to buy materials to fix the roof in the front porch and the kitchen.

loans.name: Basidelez

texts.es:
Basidelez tiene 47 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos en la zona rural de Sallique, a 90 minutos de la ciudad de Pucará, su población se dedica al cultivo de limón acido y ganadería, que pertenece a Jaén, ubicado en la región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El es muy conocido en su zona por dedicarse a brindar el servicio de maestro de obra en construcción, tiene una familia unida, su esposa le apoya en el pequeño negocio que tiene en su domicilio en la venta de granos como son menestras, maíz, trigo.

Basidelez ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para invertirlo en la compra de herramientas para su trabajo de maestro de obras de construcción cascos, guantes, algunos moldes y una segunda parte para abastecer su negocio con víveres arroz, aceite, fideos, menestras para ofrecerlos a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Basidelez, 47, lives with his wife and children in the rural area of Sallique, which is 90 minutes from the city of Pucará.  The local people grow lemons and work in livestock farming.  The area belongs to Jaén in the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountain range of Peru.

He is very well known in the area because he provides service as a master builder.  He has a well-knit family and his wife supports him by running a small business at home selling grains such as corn and wheat, and groceries.

Basidelez has requested a loan in the amount of 1,500 PEN to buy work tools for construction, such as hardhats, gloves, and molds.  He will use the rest to buy groceries for the business such as rice, oil, noodles, and vegetables to offer customers and generate more income for the family.

loans.use: To buy work tools: hardhats and gloves, and to buy groceries for his store.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz tiene 25 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos en la zona rural de Oyotún, una comunidad con clima agradable, su población se dedica al comercio, cultivos de arroz, yucas, maíz, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales pavos, patos, cerdos, nos explica que se dedica a esta actividad para poder sostener su hogar.

Es una madre emprendedora ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para invertir en la compra de animales pequeños para posteriormente engordarlos y ofrecerlos a un mejor precio y así generara mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Beatriz, 25, lives with her children in the rural area of Oyotún, a community with a mild climate.  The local people work in trade and cultivation of rice, yucca plant, and corn.  Oyotún is two hours form the city of Chiclayo, on the northern coast of Peru.

Beatriz raises and sells animals such as turkeys, ducks and pigs in order to earn an income to support the household.  She is an enterprising mother who has requested a loan in the amount of 1,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa to buy small animals to raise and sell for the best price possible in an aim to generate more income for the family.

loans.use: To buy small animals such as ducks, turkeys and hens.

loans.name: Jose Anacleto

texts.es: José de 37 años de edad habita en condiciones muy humildes y sencillas junto a su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su compañera de vida y sus dos  hijos de 19 años y 7 años de edad. Desde hace mucho tiempo trabaja como empleado de una empresa cercana a su localidad  de esa forma mantiene a su querida familia.  Su principal patrimonio es su casa la cual es de bahareque, sencilla y un poco deteriorada. Por lo anterior desea construir una nueva casa en su terreno ya que no se siente muy seguro en la vivienda actual. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera, cemento, grava y arena. Espera poder contar con este apoyo lo antes posible ya que para José es muy importante mudarse lo antes posible.
texts.en: José is 37 years old. He lives in very humble and simple conditions with his family group. It is made up of his life's companion and their two children, aged 19 and 7. He has worked as an employee for a long time at a business close to his community and that is how he supports his beloved family. His main asset is his house which is made of wattle and daub. It is a simple house and is a little deteriorated. Because of this, he wants to build a new house on his land because he doesn't feel very safe in the house he has. He is asking for this loan from FUSAI to invest in buying galvanized sheeting, wood, cement, gravel and sand. He hopes to be able to have this support as soon as possible, because for José it is very important to move as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheeting, wood, cement, gravel and sand to build a small house.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es: La señora Daniela tiene 31 años casada con dos que son de las edades de 10 y 7años, ella se dedica a la venta de batería de movilidades en su puesto de venta que se encuentra ubicada en la populosa feria de la zona 16 de Julio, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la señora Daniela va a usar este préstamo para compra de baterías por mayor para surtir su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar su stock, La señora Daniela enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia diaria y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir surtiendo su mercadería y así de esta manera genera más ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Daniela is 31 years old. She is married and has two children, aged 10 and 7. She works selling vehicle batteries from her stall in the busy market of the  16 de Julio area. This loan is her first cycle in the institution. Daniela is going to use this loan to buy batteries wholesale to stock her business. Her reason for asking for this loan is to increase her stock. Daniela faces challenges in her business, which are the daily competition. She is going to use the profits to continue stocking her merchandise and in this way generate more income.

loans.use: to buy batteries wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the coffe pickers and buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es: Domitila, de 49 años, es una mujer buena y alegre, está casada y tiene tres hijos, de 30, 26 y 24 años, quienes ya son mayores e independientes. vive en su casa junto a su esposo. El trabajo de Domitila, consiste en la venta de frutas regionales durante el día, sale a la vereda de su casa y ahí exhibe las deliciosas frutas seleccionadas los cuales compra en el mercado mayorista regional, además por las noche vende comida regionales, sale a partir de las 05 de la tarde y empieza a realizar sus preparados, entre lo que ofrece a sus comensales como la patarahsca, pollo a la parrilla, chorizo ahumado, tacacho, Juanes, etc. lleva 12 años realizando este trabajo, el cual lo hace sola. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le da el espacio suficiente para tener dos ingresos en su hogar, además la cocina siempre fue su pasión. Este su octavo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante,además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de S/.3500 soles, comprara frutas al por mayor e ingredientes para vender sus comidas tales como arroz, verduras, carnes, entre otros.
texts.en: Domitila is 49 years old. she is a good and cheerful woman. She is married and has three children, aged 30, 26 and 24. They are grown and on their own. She lives in her house with her husband. Domitila's work is selling regional fruit during the day. She goes out to the sidewalk in front of her house and shows her delicious fruit which she buys in the regional wholesale market. At night she also sells regional food. She starts to prepare at 5 in the afternoon and offers her diners patarahsca, grilled chicken, smoked sausage, tacacho, juanes, etc. She has been doing this work for 12 years and works alone. What she likes about her work is that it gives her enough space to have two incomes in the household and cooking has always been her passion. This is her eighth loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support that she is getting to keep going forward. She is also committed to making her payments on time. With the amount of S/.3500 soles that she has asked for, she will buy fruit wholesale and ingredients to sell her food, such as rice, vegetables, meat, and more.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables, meat, rice, and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more provisions like sugar and milk for resale.

loans.name: Baloon Bay's Group

texts.en:
These members are part of group called Baloon Bay, which is made up of six people who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group is Evans who is 40 years old. He is married to a woman named Comfort. They have two children, who attend school. Evans lives with his wife, and together they provide for the household expenses.

It is for this reason that Evans has been designing and sewing men's clothing from his home for ten years. He needs a loan to buy an embroidery machine in Ghana. This machine would be used to facilitate his work. In order to expand his business, Evans has partnered with the other members to request a third loan from ID-Ghana. Their previous loans have been fully repaid. They need a total of GHS 4,500 to improve their businesses.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine in Ghana.

loans.name: Santigie

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Santigie. He is married and has two children aged ten and six. In 1995, Santigie established his fuel business. He began his business because he was not too educated. Working 7 days a week and 24 hours a day, she earns about Le 550,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. 

Santigie requires a loan in order to purchase more gallons of fuel for resale. In the future, he plans to become a supplier of fuel to other stations. He is very hardworking and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of fuel for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for labor to pick the coffee beans.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Isatu.  She is married and has three children aged 20, 15 and 10. In 2007, Isatu established her clothing and textiles materials business. She began her business because she want to assist herself in taking care of the home. Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, she earns about Le 250,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Isatu requires a loan in order to buy more different kinds of clothing that is in fashion. 

In the future, Isatu plans to give her children a very good education. She is very hardworking and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of clothing that is in fashion for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more provisions of different kinds for resale

loans.name: Binyomo 3 Group

texts.en:
The group binyomo 3 is composed of five individuals living in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative, Naomi, is 40 years old. Naomi never attended school but has 10 years of work experience in selling fish. She is married to a mason, and they have three dependent children, all in school. In order to provide for her children, Naomi has been selling fresh fish. 

Naomi buys fish from the harbor in Ghana. With the goal of bolstering her business, Naomi, together with the other members of the Binyomo 3 group who are also fish sellers, is seeking an eighth loan in the amount of GHS 5,600 from ID-Ghana. Their prior loan has been duly repaid.

loans.use: To buy two cartons of fresh fish from the harbor and sell to customers in two weeks.

loans.name: Phaebe

texts.en: Phaebe is a thirty-four-old single female with five children of which four go to school. Phaebe deals in the clothes business. She works four days a week and twelve hours a day in the clothes market.  She also works in the transport business as additional income. Phaebe started the business to have a source of income and wants money to buy clothes. Phaebe hopes to buy land and expand the business. However, high taxes and the lack of enough capital are the challenges being faced.  Phaebe is a hardworking woman.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: A loan of $1,200 helped Sahiba to buy a sewing machine, iron and fabric.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is 38 years old and lives in the Kakata area; she’s married to a taxi driver. They have two children, ages 17 and 20; both live at home and the youngest one is attending school. 

Since 2001, Deborah has been running her own shop selling rubber dishes such as plates, tubs, buckets, pans, bowls, among others. She makes a wide range of profit.  Deborah sells from Monday to Saturday spending ten hours per day on her business. Deborah stated that she started this business by selling for her mother. 

Deborah has requested this loan to purchase more rubber dishes to increase her range of sales. 

The main problem she faces is the need to repair and maintain her shop from criminals entering at night.  

She described herself as very strong and hard working woman.  She wants to open another shop, and will use the profits to send her children to university.

loans.use: to purchase more rubber dishes to increase the range of sales.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is a fifth grade dropout, 44 years old, and married to a driver.  She has six children, ages 18 to 30; only three are in school and living at home. 

Cynthia is running a shop in the capital city of Margibi County, which is good at producing rubber in Liberia. In this shop, Cynthia sells many kinds of drinks likes stout, beer, soft drinks, energy drinks, dry gins, etc.  She started this business by doing out of town business, where she used to take the goods on credit; she learned this trade from her mother.  Her current  problem is less income since the holiday season is closer. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more goods mentioned above for her business. 

She enjoys her business because the business helps to improve her life and the children's lives.  Her dreams are to expand her business even more, and send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more goods for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods to advance her business.

loans.name: Maria De La Paz

texts.es: María de 26 años de edad habita en casa de su padre junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 9 y 6 años de edad. Desde hace dos años trabaja en una panadería por lo cual percibe un ingresos mensual que  le sirve para ayudar a sostener la economía de su hogar. Su deseo es mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales por lo que quiere construir un cuarto dentro del terreno de su padre quien le ha proporcionado el espacio para la construcción. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento, arena y grava para comenzar lo antes posible la construcción y poder mudarse junto a sus hijos.
texts.en: María is 26 years old and lives in her father's house with her life partner and two children, aged nine and six years old.  For two years, María has been working in a bakery and earns a monthly income which helps her to support the household economy.  María wants to improve her living conditions and so wants to build a bedroom on her father's land.  He has given María a space to build this room.  María has applied for a loan from FUSAI in order to buy bricks, cement, sand, and gravel in order to start construction work and to move her children into the room as soon as possible  .

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, and gravel, in order to build and bedroom.

loans.name: Mary

texts.es:
Mary tiene 31 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Desde niña creció en el campo junto a sus padres quienes se dedicaban integralmente a la agricultura y producción de cacao, achiote, barbasco y otros similares por ser la actividad más popular de su localidad.Fue así que aprendió a desarrollar este oficio y logró convertirlo en su principal sustento económico.Actualmente cuenta con 2 hectáreas de cultivo que trabaja con el firme apoyo de su esposo logrando vender sus cosechas al finalizar cada campaña en los centros de venta de su localidad. Al ser una persona muy acomedida para las actividades comerciales optó hace un tiempo en dedicarse también a la crianza de vacas porque puede obtener muy buenas ganancias. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante.
Desea en esta oportunidad contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para comprar abono orgánico y una pequeña vaca.
texts.en:
Mary is 31 years old and has two children.  They live together in the house they own.  Mary grew up in the country with her parents, who worked in farming and growing cacao, annatto, barbasco and other similar products. This was the most popular work in their town.  It was through her parents that Mary learned this trade and managed to make it a source of income for herself.  She currently has two hectares of land where she works with support from her husband.  They manage to sell their crops in their local town at the end of every harvest.  Given her aptitude for business, some time ago Mary also decided to start working raising cows as this work would allow her to earn very good profits.  This is Mary's first loan with Kiva and she is very grateful for the financial support that she will receive in order for her to prosper.

On this occasion Mary would like to apply for 1000 Nuevo Soles in order to buy organic manure and a young cow.

loans.use: to buy organic manure and a young cow.

loans.name: Kelita

texts.es: Kelita, de 69 años, es una mujer alegre, amable y muy emprendedora, es madre de siete hijos de los cuales todos ya son mayores e independientes, vive con su esposo Walter en su casa propia, ellos a diario trabajan mucho para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Kelita se dedica a la agricultura, se levanta muy temprano para ir a cultivar, regar y preparar la tierra para sus sembríos, además tambien se dedica a la miel de abeja y sembrío de camu-camu (fruta regional de la selva peruana), lleva más de 23 años en está actividad. Le gusta su trabajo ya que tiene tiempo y puede compartirlo con su esposo, tiene buenas ventas ya que los productos que le dan sus tierras son muy buenos, envía sus productos a la ciudad de Lima donde su hijo se encarga de venderlos, espera poder mantenerse así y más adelante poder empezar con otro tipo de sembríos. Este será su crédito    número 03 con Kiva, por ello solicita de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por su parte se compromete a ser puntual en sus cuotas y no quedar mal con el grupo al que pertenece ya que todos son muy responsables y buenos. Con el monto solicitado 3800 soles, comprará mas semillas para sembrar, abono orgánico y pagara a algunos trabajadores para que le ayuden a sembrar pimiento y iniciar con un nuevo sembrío.
texts.en: Kelita is 69 years old and is a happy, friendly, and very enterprising woman.  She is a mother to seven children, all of whom are now independent adults.  Kelita lives with her husband, Walter, in their own house.  Every day they work hard to provide the family with a better quality of life. Kelita makes a living in farming and wakes up very early to go out and grow, water, and prepare her land for her seedlings.  Kelita also has honey bees and grows camu-camu (a regional fruit found in the Peruvian jungle).  Kelita has been doing this work for over 23 years.  She really likes her work and she has time that she can spend with her husband.  Kelita makes good sales as the products from her land are very good.  She sends them to Lima where her son sells them.  Kelita hopes to keep up with this business and, later on, want to be able to sell other crops.  This will be Kelita's third loan with Kiva and she is applying for it so that she can realise her plans.  Kelita promises to make her repayments on time and to be a good example in her group, where the members are good and responsible people.  With this loan of 3800 Nuevo Soles, Kelita will buy more seeds to sow and organic manure, and will pay some labourers to help her to sow peppers and start a new crop.

loans.use: to buy organic manure and seeds, and to pay labourers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, fish, meat, oil, and drinks to expand her business.

loans.name: Dora's Group

texts.en:
Dora is 57 years old. She is married and resides with one child in Teshie, Ghana. She has been working selling groceries for four years, making a profit of GHS 20 per day. Her husband provides tailoring services. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Dora is requesting a loan of GHS 2,000 to purchase groceries to sell in her community.  With this loan, she hopes to earn more income for the family.

Some of her products are displayed in the photograph.  

In the future, she would like to expand the business and send her child to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell in her community.

loans.name: Delmy Suyapa

texts.es: Delmy, tiene 43 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos y vive en el municipio de San Pedro Sula. Hace 10 años que se dedica a la venta de tortillas de harina de maíz.  El negocio lo ha mantenido mediante la inversión de varios prestamos, actualmente  ha solicitado otro por 13,000 Lempiras para poder comprar los insumos para la elaboración de las tortillas, como es la harina de maíz y leña, y también utilizara una parte para hacer unos arreglos a la hornilla donde hace las tortillas. Su meta es que su negocio siga creciendo  y así poder sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en: Delmy is 43 years old. She is a single mother, has three children and lives in San Pedro Sula. She has been selling corn tortillas for ten years. Through different loans, she has been able to keep afloat with her business. She is requesting a new one of 13,000 lempiras [HNL] to buy supplies to make tortillas, such as corn flour and firewood. She will also use some of the money to repair the hotplates where she prepares the tortillas. Her goal is to continue expanding her business and get ahead with her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make tortillas and repair the hotplates where she prepares them.

loans.name: Eunia

texts.en:
Eunia is 40 years old and lives in the town of Mbale, in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has five children, four of whom are currently in school. For the past 20 years, Eunia has been working hard to manage her bar, which sells drinks. 

To help expand her business, Eunia has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to add capital to the business and buy more soda, beer, spirits and wine to sell, and will help Eunia to generate greater profits and increase profits. Eunia hopes that in the future she will be able to attain more buildings of her own. 

Eunia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Eunia who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to add capital to the business and buy more soda, beer, spirits and wine to sell.

loans.name: Federesi

texts.en:
Federesi is 17 years old and lives in the town of Lganga, in the Iganga region of Uganda. She has no children.  For the past 2 year, Federesi has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which deals in various products. 

To help expand her business, Federesi has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more food items such as bread and milk for sale.  This will help Federesi to generate greater profits which will enable her to buy a plot of land.  Federesi hopes that in the future she will be able to build a permanent house.

Federesi is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to stock more food items such as bread and milk for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for an internship program

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for an internship program

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for an internship program

loans.name: Rosa Estela

texts.es: Rosa de 34 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su grupo familiar conformado por su compañero de vida y tres hijos de 10 años, 7 años y 3 años de edad. Para ella y su compañero de vida lo más importante son sus hijos y es por ellos que trabajan duramente para llevar el sustento diario. Rosa se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos desde hace 13 años y así logra colaborar con la economía del hogar. Con el fin de dar condiciones más seguras a su familia solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de puertas y ventanas  para la vivienda ya que las que tiene se encuentran deterioradas y no dan la seguridad adecuada. Espera poder tener este apoyo ya que no cuenta con el capital disponible para hacerlo por su cuenta pero con lo que percibe mensualmente de su trabajo puede hacer frente a las cuotas que el crédito implica.
texts.en: Rosa, 34, lives in her own home alongside her family, made up her spouse and three children, ages 10, 7, and 3. To her and her spouse, their children are the most important thing and they work hard for them in order to bring home the daily bread. Rosa has worked as a housekeeper for the past 13 years, and she has been able to contribute to the household economy this way. In order to provide her family with more secure conditions, she is asking for this loan from Fusai to buy doors and windows for her home, since the ones she has are dilapidated and don't provide adequate security. She hopes to be able to get this support, since she doesn't have the money available to do it on her own. But with what she earns working every month, she can make the loan payments.

loans.use: to buy doors and windows for greater security in her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for an internship program

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for an internship program

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson is 35 years old. He supports four children. He is married to Emily. They are blessed with four children of 13, 10, 7 and 5 years respectively. He has been in business for five years, and his monthly income is 4,500 Kenyan Shillings.

Dickson has borrowed a loan to buy more stocks of animal feeds, drugs, insecticides, pesticides, phosphates and seedlings for his agrovet. From the anticipated profits, he will employ new staff to assist in the sale the stock. This is his first loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of animal feeds , drugs, insecticides, pesticides, phosphates and seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for an internship program

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for an internship program

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 23 personnes fait partie du Banc villageois qui a été créé le 12 décembre 2009. Il est composé de membres qui entretiennent de très bonnes relations. Les réunions sont attendues avec impatience car c'est l'occasion de se retrouver entre elles. Il y a une bonne complicité entre elles et sont solidaires. Leur principale activité est le commerce.
Adama, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 38 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont 01 fille. Elle fait comme activité la vente de beignet et de café. Elle compte acheter 25 Kg de farine à 10 000 F, 10 Kg de café à 1600 F le Kg, 10 L d'huile à 9000 F, du sucre à 15000 F et divers. Elle utilise en moyenne 06 Kg de farine par jour pour la confection de beignets et fait un bénéfice de 4000 F les jours de marchés hebdomadaires et 1500 F les autres jours de la semaine donc en moyenne 13 000 F la semaine. Elle vend également du café à 50 F le gobelet.
Les bénéfices réalisés servent à renforcer son épargne, et aussi elle aide son mari dans la gestion de la maison (scolarité des enfants et nourriture).
texts.en:
This group of 23 people is part of the Banc Villageois that was established on December 12, 2009. It is made up of members who are on very good terms.

Meetings are awaited with impatience because they are occasions for the members to get together. There is a good complicity among them, and they really stand together. Their main business is retail.

Adama is the woman standing on the right and raising her hand in the photograph. She's 38 years old, married, and the mother of three boys and one girl. Her business consists in selling doughnuts and coffee.

She intends to buy 25 kg of flour for XOF 10'000, 10 kg of coffee for XOF 1'600 per kg, 10 liters of oil for XOF 9'000, sugar for XOF 15'000, and other products.

On average, she needs 6 kg of flour per day to make doughnuts. Her profits amount to XOF 4'000 on weekly fair days, and to XOF 1'500 on other days. On average, her weekly profits reach XOF 13'000. She also sell coffee for XOF 50 a cup.

She uses her profits to bolster her savings, and also to help her husband cover the expenses of the household (children's education and food).

loans.use: to buy flour, coffee, oil, and sugar

loans.name: Priscilah

texts.en:
Priscilah is 40 years old, married to Julius, and they are blessed with four children, aged between 18 and 6 years. Priscilah runs a beauty salon in Kapsabet town. She has been in this business for the last six years. From this business, she gets a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

She borrowed a second loan of KES 60,000 after successfully paying back her first loan. With this loan, she will be able to purchase cosmetics and products, such as hair pieces, braids, salon combs, hair lotions and oils, shampoos and conditioners among other items that she may need in her salon.

With the anticipated profits, she will pay her children's school fees, repay her loan, as well as expand and improve her saloon services.

Her dream is to give the best to her children, e.g. educate them to the highest level possible, and expand her business to a point where she will be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and products, such as hair pieces, braids, salon combs, hair lotions and oils, etc. for her salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice by the bag for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for an internship program

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a huge quantity of rice for her business.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana has more than 10 years of experience as a hair stylist, starting in her home country of the Dominican Republic. With a cosmetology license from the State of New Jersey, Juana started working in Lexoos Salon, one of the oldest and busiest beauty salons on George Street in New Brunswick. Being paid entirely on commission, Juana developed her sales skills and built a strong client base at Lexoos. 

In May 2011, Juana decided to open her own business and purchased a beauty salon in downtown New Brunswick. Juana invested $20,000 of her savings to purchase the existing business and to buy new equipment. She continues to invest all of her time as well, working seven days a week and coming into the shop even on holidays. 

This loan will allow Juana's salon to offer new services, such as pedicures. Juana will generate additional income and also be able to further differentiate her business from other beauty salons in New Brunswick.

loans.use: To purchase pedicure equipment for her thriving beauty salon.

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah is 40 years old and married with 4 children. She deals in cattle fattening and milking as her major source of income. She owns 80 cows, the majority of which are for milk production. Through income earned from milk, Fridah has managed to look after her family together with her husband by providing them all the basic necessities of life like housing, food, medication, and paying tuition for their 4 school-going children. 

In addition to cattle, Fridah owns a retail shop in a trading center near her residence. She started this business because people would walk long distances to far away places to buy simple household items. She therefore decided to serve their needs and has since increased the capital base to provide most of the demanded items.

Fridah is applying for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to buy more stock of items, especially soft drinks such as soda, because it’s almost the holiday season when people will be holding parties. She therefore wants to be able to meet the demand. Stocking early will also help her to buy cheaply before prices rise. She is hard working and innovative.

loans.use: to buy retail stock items such as soda, sugar, soap, and salt

loans.name: Saitua

texts.en:
Saitua is a 42-year-old married woman with seven children. She has a small plantation and grows bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years.

Saitua has requested a loan to buy chemicals, banana spray, weed killer, bush knives and a crowbar. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Saitua hopes to earn more to improve her plantation and help with her kids' education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, banana spray, weed killer, bush knives and a crowbar.

loans.name: Faalata

texts.en:
Faalata is a 30-year-old married woman with five children. She has a small plantation and grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for a year. 

Faalata has requested a loan to buy chemicals, a weed sprayer, spades, a pair of gloves, fertilizer and water gallons. She became a member of SPBD in 2013. With her profits, Faalata hopes to improve her business to help with family matters and her children's education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a weed sprayer, spades, a pair of gloves, fertilizers and water gallons.

loans.name: Tumua

texts.en: Tumua is 34 years old and married with eight children. She has a business of making and selling pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy flour, sugar, plastic bags, a large pot, baking soda and dripping oil. In the future,Tumua hopes to earn more from her business to help her family and her kids' education. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, plastic bags, a large pot, baking soda and dripping oil.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma, de 68 años, es viuda y madre de tres hijos quienes ya son mayores y tienen su propia familia, su corazón es muy grande ya que por ahora tiene a su cargo un niño de 10 años a quien cuida por que su familia lo abandono con quien vive en su casa propia. El trabajo de Norma consiste en diversas actividades, pero tiene dos principales, la primera es la costura, a su pequeño taller a donde llegan los clientes en busca de su ayuda, además ella vende productos de belleza por catalogo, estas actividades ya los viene realizando por 10 y 15 años respectivamente, trabaja sola ya que no necesita de la ayuda de otra persona para hacer su trabajo por que ya se acostumbro al ritmo y tiene sus métodos para facilitarse el trabajo. Lo que le gusta de sus actividades es que le permite disponer de su propio tiempo, además de tener la facilidad de realizar las actividades y labores de su hogar, le esta yendo bien en todo y tiene buenos ingresos gracias al esfuerzo que hace en colocar sus productos y coser lo que más puede, espera poder seguir así y generar los ingresos a su hogar que le permitan seguir viviendo tranquila. Este es su quinto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado de 2500 soles, comprará materiales para realizar su costura, entre ellas comprará; telas, hilos, elásticos, blondas, cierres, etc. Además comprará más cosméticos y productos de belleza para tener en stock y ofrecer a sus buenos clientes.
texts.en: Norma, 68, is a widow and mother of three children who are now grown and have their own families. She has a very big heart, because she is responsible for a 10-year-old boy, whom she is caring for because his family abandoned him. She lives with him in her own house. Norma's work consists of different activities, but she has two main ones. The first one is sewing in her small workshop where customers arrive looking for her help. She also sells beauty products from a catalogue. She has been working in these two jobs for 10 and 15 years respectively. She works alone because she does not need another person's help to do her work. She is accustomed to the rhythm and she has her ways to facilitate the work. What she likes about her work is that her time is her own, in addition to the fact that it is easy to do the housework. It is going well for her in all aspects and she has a good income thanks to the effort that she makes to market her products and sew as much as she can. She hopes to continue this way and earn an income for her household that will allow her to continue living comfortably. This is her fifth loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial help that she is receiving to move forward. She also promises to make her payments on time. With the amount she has applied for, 2,500 soles, she will buy materials for her sewing. Among other things, she will buy fabric, thread, elastic, silk lace, zippers, etc. She will also buy more cosmetics and beauty products to have in stock and offer to her good customers.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is 43 years old, She is married with 6 children. She lives in Mitacas Calamba, Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a farmer and a laborer who works to sustain their daily bread. Anita has been engaged in selling ready-to-wear clothes in their town in order to meet the family's needs. Anita has been in this business for 4 years and earned a monthly net income of 3500 PHP. She has been a Cumi member of Paglaum MPC since 2005 and wishes someday with the help of almighty God that her children will be able to graduate.

loans.use: to purchase assorted clothes to sell to customers.

loans.name: Jereil

texts.en: Jereil has helped her husband in their transportation business for four years to support her child and the entire family's needs. She joined GDMPC in 2012 and her previous loan used to repair the vehicle. It was successfully repaid. Recently, she borrowed a new loan to purchase a new set of tires. Her plan in the future is to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new set of tires.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en: Marife lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental along with her family. She helps her husband earn a living through providing transportation services to support the needs of her two children. In 2011, Marife joined GDMPC, and she used her previous loan to repair her vehicle. This loan was successfully repaid. Recently, she borrowed a new loan to buy a new set of tires. Her plan for the future is to acquire another unit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new set of tires.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goods for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more rice, milk, mayonnaise, among other items, to expand her sales.

loans.name: Agustinha

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is offered to Agustinha to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as coffee, sugar, salt, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, cookies and cigarettes. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Agustinha independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy coffee, sugar, salt, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, cookies and cigarettes.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a single 34 year-old mother with a five-year-old daughter.  She operates a Zoona mobile money transfer business at a shopping center located in Lusaka, Zambia.  Having been raised by her single mother, she now works very hard so that her daughter will have better opportunities and less hardship than she did during childhood.

Upon graduating from college with a diploma in Marketing, Cecilia began working for Southern Cross Motors as a sales consultant.  This is her full-time employment.  However, she sees more opportunity for income in her mobile money transfer business that she runs to supplement her earnings and provide for her daughter and 72 year-old mother.  

This loan will allow Cecilia to grow her business by adding needed working capital to service additional customers in need of financial services at her shop.  Cecilia sees the opportunity this loan can provide her in growing the business and earning more profits.  She hopes to be able to grow the business so she can leave her sales job and focus completely on growing her business.  This will also allow her more flexible working hours so she can spend more time with her young daughter.

loans.use: To add on to the money she uses to serve customers so that she can grow her mobile money business and serve more customers in need of financial services

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence is a 58 year old married man. He has 6 children and 3 of them are school going. He basically does animal rearing and poultry farming to raise additional income. He chose that business because of his love for animals, and also for commercial support towards his family. He will use the loan to buy poultry feeds which will help to increase the size of his birds. His customers are the local community and restaurants. He cages his birds in an enclosure to ascertain their safety. He is hard working and honest.

loans.use: to buy poultry feeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goods for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sports equipment and other items to continue her training business

loans.name: Juana De La Cruz

texts.es: Juana tiene 47 años de edad y es madre soltera de dos hijos. Toda su vida ha trabajado muy duro para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Tiene 28 años de dedicarse a la prestación de servicios domésticos y este oficio es su principal fuente de ingresos. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado construir su casa la cual es su principal patrimonio y que en un futuro quiere heredar a sus  hijos. Desea mejorar sus condiciones por lo que solicita este préstamo a FUSAI para invertir en la introducción de la luz eléctrica y para construir un muro perimetral para lo cual comprará cemento, hierro, arena, grava y ladrillo.
texts.en:
Juana is 46 years old and is a single mother with 2 children. She has worked hard all her life to provide for her household. She has worked in domestic service for 28 years and this is her main source of income. With a great deal of effort she has managed to build her house which is her main asset and which she wants to pass on to her children in the future. 

Juana wants to improve her living conditions, which is why she is asking for this loan from FUSAI to invest in putting in an electricity supply and to build a perimeter wall. She will buy cement, iron, sand, gravel and bricks for the wall.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel and bricks to build a perimeter wall and to install electricity.

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Phon is 33 years old and married, with three children, all in different grades in primary school. They also help Phon with his farming activities with their free time from school. Phon has a wife, who works in the same career.  Together they have been growing rice for nearly 16 years.

To help further develop his farming productivity, Phon needs working capital to invest in his current business. That’s why he is asking for a loan of KHR 3,000,000 to rent other villagers’ farmland for rice cultivation. 

His future plans are to be able to have his own land to grow a better variety and to be able to strengthen the heritage for his children. He thanks lenders for their generosities towards a poor fellow like him.

loans.use: to rent farmland for rice cultivation.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 51 years old and has been running a phone accessories sales business in Oloitoktok. She also has a mobile money transfer business. She has been in this business for two years. Esther is married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with one child.

This is her third loan term and she plans to buy more phone accessories for selling. These include phone chargers, batteries, covers and earphones. Apart from that, Esther also plans to improve her mobile money transfer business by adding more money in terms of float. 

She will use the anticipated profits to educate her child. Esther hopes to buy a house for her family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more phone accessories for selling including phone chargers, batteries, covers and earphones

loans.name: Chinfa

texts.en: Chinfa lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental with her family. She earns money by providing transportation to people in her area to support the needs of her 2 children. On weekdays, she uses the motorcycle to carry her children to school. Her previous loan from GDMPC was used to repair the motorcycle was successfully repaid. Recently, she borrowed a new loan to buy tires for the safety of her children and customers. In the future, Chinfa wants to improve her business to give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy tires.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cement for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set, and a weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Sok San

texts.en: Sok San is 18 years old. She is a university freshman who lives with her parents in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. Since graduating from high school, Sok San has been pursuing her studies in Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. She has to spend a lot on her studies. which is why she needs to take out a loan from KREDIT. In order to complete her nursing degree, Sok San is applying for for a loan of $4,100 to pay for her tuition fees. This money will help her fulfill her dream of becoming a nurse. With this degree, she hopes to get a well-paid job and to be able to offer her family better living conditions.
