loans.use: to pay the tuition fees for her university studies to become a nurse.

loans.name: Seyha

texts.en:
Seyha is ambitious and determined. A USD 950 loan from Kiva will help him pursue his dream of a career in Japanese business administration and a chance to run his own business. 

He moved to Phnom Penh city from his hometown of Takeo province after graduating from high school to take advantage of the educational opportunities there. Currently, he is a freshman at Mekong University. He will graduate in November 2017. 

With this degree, he expects to get a well-paid job and in time find the opportunity to run the business by himself.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to replace her old equipment with better equipment and buy new inventories for her business

loans.name: Norn

texts.en: Norn is 31 years of age and a resident of Baray district, Kampong Thom province. Norn is engaged in farming rice and raising pigs to provide for her only child, who is enrolling in the local primary school. She cultivates the land for the family’s sustenance and raises pigs for additional income to cover the other costs of living. She has been running the two businesses for almost 13 years, and she is able to earn a net profit of KHR 20,000 per day as add to her husband's income from his fishing activities. Norn has been with HKL for two previous loans, which were used to develop her family-owned business as well as her general living conditions. Now Norn would like to take out a new loan to buy ten pigs to place in her piggery. When they mature, she will sell them in the markets for a good price. In the future, Norn is hoping to diversify her existing business, in order to secure the overall welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy ten pigs to add to her piggery.

loans.name: Rentsenhand

texts.en: Mrs. Rentsenhand is a 61-year-old woman who lives with her husband and two sons in a ger (a traditional nomadic tent house), in Govi-Altai Province, Mongolia. Her husband is retired and stays at home. Her older children are gotten married and live away from home. Her two younger sons attend local secondary school and university, respectively. Rentsenhand has been in the meat retail business for many years, since 2000. She has built up her supply chain and has attracted loyal customers with her quality meat products and her welcoming service. She has taught her children to run small businesses and let them start their own businesses. Her daughter who lives with her own family is starting her own business, while she learns from her mother. Rentsenhand is now applying for a loan of 4,500,000 MNT to purchase a starting inventory and other items that are necessary for her daughter to start her business. She is hardworking, neat and responsible woman.

loans.use: to buy starting inventory and other items that are necessary for her daughter to start her business.

loans.name: Thioro's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 21 personnes fait partie du banc villageois de Sarèmes Sérères qui a été créé le 13 décembre 2008. Il est composé des membres qui vivent dans la même localité. Les membres sont solidaires et vivent dans la bonne entente. leurs principales activités sont le commerce et l'embouche.
Thioro, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 68 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de 06 enfants dont 01 garçon. Elle fait comme activité principale de l'embouche ovine. Elle fait cette activité depuis bien longtemps. Elle achète des moutons qu'elle élève chez elle et au bout de 06 mois, les revend dans les marchés hebdomadaires. Elle achète 05 moutons entre 25 000 et 40 000 F selon le flux du marché, des aliments pour bétail  (02 sacs) à 12 000 F, les soins vétérinaires s'élèvent à 700 F. Elle compte revendre entre 75 000 et 80 000 F le mouton. S'il reste de l'argent, elle achète du mil qu'elle va stocker chez elle et le revendre en période de soudure au plus offrant.
Avec les bénéfices, elle réinvestit dans la dépense journalière car elle est seule soutien de famille, dans les soins médicaux de ses enfants, dans les besoins de la famille et aussi ses propres besoins. Elle renforce son épargne et paie ses intérêts.
texts.en:
This groups of 21 people is part of the Banc Villageois of Sarèmes Sérères, which was established on December 13, 2008. Its members live in the same village. They stand by each other and get along well. Their main businesses are retail and raising livestock.

Thioro is the woman standing on the right and raising her hand in the photograph. She's 68 years old, a widow, and the mother of six children, out of whom one is a boy.

Her main business is raising sheep, which she has been doing for a long time. She buys sheep that she raises at her place and, after six months, she resells them at the weekly fairs.

She wants to buy five sheep, costing between XOF 25'000 and 40'000 depending on the market's flux and two sacks of animal feed costing XOF 12'000. Veterinary cares amount to XOF 700.

She intends to resell each sheep for between XOF 75'000 and 80'000. If she has some money left, she will buy some millet, store it at her place, and resell it to the highest payer during the off-season.

With her profits, she covers the daily expenses of the family since she's the only bread earner, and pay her children's healthcare. She also provides for herself. She wants to strengthen her savings and pay her interests.

loans.use: to buy and raise sheep

loans.name: Sandagsuren

texts.en:
Mr. Sandagsuren is 31 years old and a carpenter who lives with his wife and two children in their ger, a traditional nomadic tent house, in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His wife helps him to run their business, and his children under 6 attend a local kindergarten. 

Sandagsuren has been manufacturing wooden furniture since 2006 at home.  He built another ger next to theirs as a workplace later on. 

He manufactures wooden furniture by clients' orders. He has increased his quality over the time, and now his products are as good as the big manufacturers'. He also employs one helper and has taught him everything to groom him to open his own business later. 

He started building a house for his family's use.  He needs additional investment of MNT 4,700,000 to purchase insulation and construction material to finish building the house before the cold Mongolian winter comes. 

He is a kind, hard-working, and responsible man.

loans.use: to buy insulation and construction materials to finish building his house before the cold Mongolian winter comes

loans.name: Yomary

texts.es:
La señora Yomary es una persona muy trabajadora, humilde  y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Se dedica a la venta de productos básicos, en su negocio el cual es una Pulpería y la tiene desde hace más de 4  años.
Doña Yomary  necesita el préstamo para la compra de arroz, frijoles, queso, pan, arroz, manteca, mantequilla, café, leche, refrescos, etc. gran variedad de productos y así seguir realizando su negocio.
Doña Yomary  con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten y a la vez espera aumentar sus productos para tener bien surtida su pulpería ya que se acerca la época navideña y en estas fechas vende más.
Doña Yomary  gracias a esto poder mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar. 



Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre  del  2013
texts.en:
Yomary is a humble, responsible and hardworking person. She lives in a village in Southern Honduras, together with her family. She sells staple food; she has had a grocery store for more than four years.

Yomary needs a loan to buy rice, beans, cheese, bread, shortening, butter, coffee, milk, beverages, etc. With this variety, she will continue with her business. She hopes to increase her sales with this loan and that her store is stocked now that Christmas is coming, the time of the year when she sells the most.

Thanks to this loan, Yomary will be able to improve her family’s quality of life, by increasing their income.

Choluteca, Honduras – October 2013

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, cheese, bread and other supplies for her store.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita is fifty-three years old, married, and has four children. She helps her husband in managing their own garden to earn a living. She has been in business for 13 years, and she has been able to provide for the needs of the family. Her previous loan from GDMPC was used to purchase fertilizer and was successfully repaid. Recently, she took out a new loan, to buy new seedlings to improve the farm. She plans to use the additional revenue that is generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase new seedlings for her garden.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia helps her husband to operate their own farm, where they plant, harvest and sell rice for a living. Lydia has been in business for over 30 years, and she earns enough for the family. In 2007, Lydia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and her living situation. Her previous loan was used to buy fertilizer and was successfully repaid. Recently, she took out a new loan to buy organic fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Saidu

texts.en: This is 33-year-old Saidu.  He is married and has two children aged 6 and 2 years old. In 2003, Saidu established his shoe-making business. He began his business because he wanted to become self-employed and to help his family. Working seven days a week and eighteen hours a day, he earns about 5,000,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of  4,000,000 SLL. Saidu requires a loan in order to buy more shoe-making materials that will enable him to manufacture more shoes for resale. In the future, Saidu plans to build a house for dwelling with his family. He is very hardworking and he thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more shoe-making materials that will enable him to manufacture more shoes for resale

loans.name: Rakhija

texts.en:
Rakhija is a 27-year-old housewife in a small village of Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri District. She lives with her husband, Aftab, and two children. She and her husband both received education until standard IX (grade 9). They also send one child to school; the other is too small to go to school. Both of them are very ambitious, and want to give a good life to their children.
 
They have their own land where her husband cultivates different vegetables and crops in different seasons and supplies those items to the wholesale market. Now she plans to take a loan to invest in potato cultivation by buying necessary supplies like potato seeds, fertilizers, urea and more. Enterprising and knowledgeable, Rakhija decided to plant potatoes because potatoes are a year-round crop and a very popular vegetable. Potatoes are used in most Indian dishes. She knows she can earn more profit through it. 

Her future plan is to improve her financial condition and to extend her business.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds, fertilizers, urea and more for potato cultivation.

loans.name: Anjana

texts.en:
Anjana is a 38-year-old hardworking homemaker who lives with her husband and two children. Anjana and her husband both have received secondary education. One child goes to school and the other has not started school yet. 

Her husband is involved in agricultural business, but her husband’s income in not sufficient to rear their children and to lead a proper lifestyle in today’s economy. 

She wants to give support to her husband financially. So she wants to purchase a cow so that she can sell milk as well as different dairy products in the market. She wants to earn money and to give financial assistance to her family.

In the future she dreams to buy more cows and have a huge cattle husbandry business. BJS stands beside her to fight against poverty, so she is very much obliged to BJS and Kiva that they came into her life as a light of success.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to sell milk and different dairy products in the market.

loans.name: Manjuma

texts.en:
Manjuma is 40 years old and her husband is 52 years old. Both of them are illiterate and can only sign their name. Manjuma has four children. Two of them are receiving education and the other two work with their father. Manjuma is a housewife and her husband is farmer. By farming they are not earning enough money, so for that reason, Manjuma thought to shift to some other business. 

They have applied for a loan to BJS so that they can purchase a cow and can sell milk and milk products like ghee, paneer, cheese, etc. in the market to earn money. They dream that they will invest the profit that they make in their field so that they can cultivate different types of crops and can have more earnings for their family. They are thankful and grateful to BJS for this help.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to sell milk and milk products.

loans.name: Eldith

texts.es:
Eldith, de 53 años, es una mujer buena y muy responsable,educo a sus hijos siendo madre soltera, ahora sus hijos son mayores e  independientes, pero vive con dos de ellos en su casa propia. El trabajo de Eldith consiste en la venta de ropa y la venta de cosméticos por catálogo, su especialidad son las colonias y perfumes, ella sale a la calle en busca de sus amigos, vecinos y familiares en busca de vender alguna prenda, además ahí mismo aprovecha y ofrece su productos de cometidos y perfumería en general, lleva realizando este trabajo por 10 años aproximadamente, y lo hace sola ya que ahora solo ve por sus gastos ya que sus hijos le ayudan en algunas cosas. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le da tiempo para poder descansar y estar en su casa haciendo sus actividades. Este será su quinto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado de S/. 3000  comprará más productos por catálogo tales como ropa, perfumes, colonias, labiales, entre otros.
texts.en:
Eldith, 53, is a good, responsible woman who, as a single mother, educated her now grown, independent children. Two of her children still live with her in the house she owns. Eldith sells clothing and catalog cosmetics, especially colognes and perfumes. She goes out searching for friends, neighbors, and relatives who want to buy clothing, cosmetics, and perfumes. This has been her profession for about 10 years. She works alone and now she only wants to be able to pay her expenses, as her children help her out with some things. She likes that her job allows her time to rest and do things around the house.

This will be her fifth loan cycle with Kiva, and she is grateful for the funding to keep going. She promises to makes her payments on time. She will use the loan of  S/. 3000 to buy more catalog items like clothing, perfumes, colognes, and lipsticks.

loans.use: to buy wholesale clothing, perfumes, lipsticks, and more.

loans.name: Siyovush

texts.ru: Сиёвуш житель Яванского района, ему 31 год. Он обеспечивает свою большую семью за счет растениеводства. У него жена, трое маленьких детей и еще с ними живут его родители. Сиёвуш как главный добытчик семьи работает усердно на орошаемом поле. Он занимается выращиванием овощей и пшеницы вот уже 10 лет. Он является бригадиром полеводческой бригады и относится к своей работе очень серьезно. Сейчас Сиёвуш готовит землю к очередному посеву. Он запрашивает кредит, чтобы купить качественные семена пшеницы, минеральные удобрения и топливо.
texts.en: Siyovush is 31, and lives in Yavan. He supports his large family by farming. He has a wife, three young children, and his parents also live with them. As the main breadwinner in the family, Siyovush works hard in his irrigated field. He has been growing vegetables and wheat for 10 years. He is in charge of the local irrigation brigade and take his job very seriously. Right now he is getting the land ready for winter and the next planting. He is requesting a loan to buy high quality wheat seeds, fertilizer, and fuel.

loans.use: buy high quality wheat seeds, fertilizer, and fuel.

loans.name: Kol

texts.en: Becoming an English teacher has always been Kol’s dream. Kol was accepted into Human Resource University and now with the chance to achieve her dream is concerned about affording tuition fee. As she explains, her parents are farmers and earn about $8 per day. This income is used for the family’s daily expenses only. To reach her goal, Kol is requesting a loan of $1,980 to pay for her tuition fee. With the degree of English literacy, she hopes to be an English teacher in her hometown.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fee

loans.name: Glendy Del Carmen

texts.es: Glendy de 34 años de edad es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 14 y 7 años de edad y habita en casa de su propiedad. Desde hace 7 años posee una tienda en su lugar de residencia en la cual vende variedad de productos de primera necesidad como: azúcar, sal, frijoles, arroz, golosinas, etc. Este es su principal fuente de ingresos y es como mantiene a su familia. Desea mejorar las condiciones de su casa ya que con el tiempo las ventanas de su casa se han deteriorado y no son muy seguras. Además desea reparar los canales y salidas de agua ya que cuando llueve se mojan sus pocas pertenencias. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ventanas, hechura y colocación de canales con lámina galvanizada y bajadas para la canalización de las aguas lluvias y así dar  mayor seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Glendy is 34 years old and is a single mother with two children aged 14 and 7 years. She lives in a house which she owns. For 7 years she has had a shop in her home where she sells daily staples such as sugar, salt, beans, rice, sweets etc. This is her main source of income and is how she supports her family. 

Glendy wants to improve the condition of her home since the windows have deteriorated over time and are not very secure. She also wants to repair the gutters and downpipes since when it rains her few possessions get wet.

She is asking for this loan from FUSAI to buy windows and to pay for fabrication and installation of gutters made from galvanised sheets and downpipes to channel the rainwater, so she can give her family more security.

loans.use: to buy windows and pay for fabrication and installation of gutters made from galvanised sheets and downpipes to channel the rainwater.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is married and has three children. Lita owns and operates a farm where she plants and harvests a variety of vegetables, which she has been doing for more than five years. She is able to provide for her family's daily living expenses.

Lita is requesting another loan from GDMPC, which she will use to purchase fertilizers and seedlings.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Jose Alvaro

texts.es: José es un hombre de 39 años de edad quien reside en casa propia desde hace 6 años junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos de 9 y 13 años de edad. Para él lo más importante es su familia y es por ella que se esfuerza por buscar mejores oportunidades de crecimiento. Desde hace 4 años junto a su compañera de vida lograron adecuar una pequeña tienda en su lugar de residencia la cual ha sido su principal fuente de ingresos.  Su deseo es mejorar las instalaciones de su tienda ya que como se muestra en la fotografía no cuenta con un corredor y esto incomoda a los clientes cuando llueve o hace sol. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y polines para hacer el corredor que tanta falta le hace.
texts.en:
José is a 39 year old man who has lived in his own house for 6 years with his life partner and their two children aged 9 and 13 years. For him the family is the most important thing and for this reason he works hard to find better opportunities for development. Four years ago José and his partner installed a small shop in their home and this has been their main source of income.

José wants to improve the facilities in his shop. As can be seen in the photo there is no passageway and this inconveniences customers when it is sunny or raining. He is asking for this loan from FUSAI to buy galvanised metal sheets, wood and beams to build the passageway which he really needs.

loans.use: to buy galvanised metal sheets, wood and beams for building a passageway.

loans.name: Anna Lisa

texts.en: Anna Lisa is 34 years old and single. She owns & operates a business providing water refilling services to the local community. Anna Lisa has been engaged in her business for four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2010, Anna Lisa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Her previous loan taken from GDMPC was successfully repaid. She requests a new loan to repair the machine used in her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to repair the machine used in her business

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en: Mylene helps her husband to operate their own farm, planting and harvesting rice to sell to earn a living. She has been in this business for three years. In 2008, Mylene joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services, to help improve her business and living situation. Her previous loan taken that was used to purchase fertilizer has been successfully repaid. She requests a new loan to purchase fertilizer for the next cropping season. In the future, Mylene wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for the next cropping season

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en: Merlie helps her husband managing their own rice farm to make a living.  In 2009, Merlie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan to purchase fertilizer to improve the farm. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Neang is 29 years old. She is married and resides with her three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. 

She has been making round baskets to sell for more than three years, earning about USD 2 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who makes an income of USD 6 each day. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Neang is requesting a loan of USD 1,100 to buy a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help reduce their expense on transportation and help her husband easily transport to work. 

In the future, she would like to run a grocery store and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she wants to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia tiene 53 años de edad y es madre soltera de dos hijos de 25 y 21 años de edad. Lucia se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora y visionaria ya que a pesar de su edad tiene mucha energía y no  para de trabajar.  Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos desde hace 6 años. Para ella lo más importante es su familia y es por ella que siempre está pendiente de mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Desea construir corredor a su vivienda la que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado levantar. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, pilares de cemento, polines y otros materiales necesarios para hacer la construcción del corredor lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Lucía, 53, is the single mother of two children, ages 25 and 21.  She's known as a hardworking, enterprising, and visionary woman because she has a lot of energy and never stops working despite her age.  She has earned a living raising and selling chickens for six years.  The most important thing to her is her family, which is why she's always looking for ways to improve her living conditions.

Lucía wants to put a porch on her house, which she managed to build with a lot of effort.  She's requesting this loan from FUSAI to buy galvanized sheet metal, cement pillars, beams, and the other materials she needs to build the porch as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting, cement pillars, and beams

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es: Sofía, de 62 años, es viuda y tiene dos hijos quienes ya tienen una edad mayor y tienen familia propia, tiene una casa propia en donde vive a lado de sus dos hijos, quienes le ayudan en los gastos del hogar. Sofia se dedica a la confección, actividad que realiza en su casa, lleva ya cuarenta años trabajando en la confección, es decir hizo toda su vida con este negocio y educo y crió con este trabajo a sus hijos, además recién lleva tres años vendiendo frutas y golosinas, trabaja sola ya que no hay mucha demanda por estos días como para tener que contratar a alguien mas. Le gusta de su trabajo que le permite hacer algo que le emociona, además tiene tiempo libre para poder descansar y hacer otras cosas en su casa, le esta yendo bien ya que sus clientes siguen yendo en busca de que les solucione su problema de vestir, espera nada mas mantenerse ya que por ahora no tiene planes a corto plazo. Este será el quinto préstamo con Kiva, y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de S/.2000 soles, comprará materiales de confección tales como tela, hilos, agujas, entre otros.
texts.en:
Sofía is 62 years old. She is a widow and has two adult children who now have families of their own. She has her own house and lives next to her two children, who help her out with the household expenses. Sofía makes a living from sewing, which she does in her home. She has been sewing for 40 years now and has based her whole life on this business, using to it bring up and educate her children. In the last 3 years she has also been selling fruit and sweets. She works on her own because these days there is not sufficient demand for her to need to employ anyone else. 

What Sofía likes about her work is that it allows her to do something she enjoys and she also has free time to rest and do other things in the house. The business is going well for her since she has customers who always come to her to sort out their clothing problems. For now she only wants to be able to provide for herself, as she has no plans in the short term. 

This will be her fifth loan with Kiva. Sofía is grateful for the financial support she is getting in order to keep making progress and she promises to pay her loan instalments punctually. With the requested sum of 2000 soles she will buy sewing materials such as fabric, thread, needles and other items.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials such as fabric, thread, needles and other items.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 33 years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Vilma operates a business planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for resale. She has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and she has been able to supplement her family's daily needs.

In 2010, Vilma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation.  Her previous loan, which she used for the farm, was successfully repaid. Recently, she has requested a new loan to purchase a new variety of seeds. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new variety of seeds

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is 45 years old, married, and has two children. He owns and operates a motorcycle transport service to earn a living. He has been in his business for over seven years and earns a good amount. He joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and he successfully repaid his previous loan, which he borrowed to pay for repairs. 

Danilo requests a new loan to buy a new set of tires. In the future, he wants to make improvements to his house and to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy a new set of tires

loans.name: Komeza Group

texts.fr:
Félix fait partie du groupe Komeza. Il habite  à Bujumbura et a 43 ans .Il est marié à Renathe une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 8 à 13 ans, tous étudient.

Il vend le service de photographie.

Il est à son quatrième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva qu’il obtient, il va augmenter son capital et acheter un appareil photo numérique professionnel pour  attirer beaucoup de clients afin de gagner plus.

Dans les années à venir, il voudrait acheter une parcelle, puis construire une maison et voir ses enfants continuer les études.
texts.en:
Félix is a member of the Komeza group. He lives in Bujumbura and is 43 years old. He is married to Renathe, a farmer. They have three children aged between eight and 13, who are all in school. 

Félix sells photography services and this is his fourth loan from Turame. With his Kiva loan, he will increase his capital and buy a professional digital camera to attract more customers in order to earn more money. 

In the years to come, he would like to buy a plot of land and build a house, and see his children continue their studies.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a professional digital camera to attract more customers in order to earn more.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
This is Samson, 61, a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. He is married to Amelita, a vendor, and they have children. He and his wife manage their household while operating their business. Samson works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Samson operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. He earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 800 in sales every day.

He is requesting a PHP 22,000 loan to help continue in the operation of his business. He will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand his product inventory.

Samson dreams that his business will continue to grow and hopes to have a long life.  He meets up every week with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God, which he studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in his business.

loans.name: Ushindi Ii Group

texts.fr:
Emmanuel fait partie du groupe  Ushindi II et  habite à Bujumbura. Il a 42 ans et est marié à Donathe. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants  âgés de 4  à 7 ans, tous étudient.
Il a sous sa charge un étudiant, membre de sa famille élargie, qui étudie et sa tante.

Il fait le commerce de boutique(riz, haricot,...)  et des habits depuis  16 ans. 

Il est à son cinquième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter   une grande quantité de riz, de haricot, et beaucoup d’habits  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il  voudrait construire  une maison en matériaux durables et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Emmanuel is a member of the Ushindi II group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 42 years old and married to Donathe. Together they have two children aged four and seven, who are both in school. Emmanuel also looks after a student, who is a member of his extended family, and his aunt.

Emmanuel has been selling dry goods and clothes for 16 years. This is his fifth loan from Turame. With his Kiva loan, he will increase his capital and buy a large quantity of rice, beans and clothes to resell in order to earn more. In the next few years, he would like to build a house from durable materials and see his children study.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of rice, beans and clothes to sell in order to earn more.

loans.name: Ubumwe Group

texts.fr:
Nestor fait partie du groupe  Ubumwe et  habite à Bujumbura. Il a 50 ans et est marié à Julie. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants  âgés de 17  à 23 ans, tous étudient.

Il fait le commerce des habits depuis  5 ans. 

Il est à son quatrième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter    beaucoup d’habits  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il  voudrait faire l’élevage du gros bétail (vaches et porcs) et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Nestor is a member of the Ubumwe group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 50 years old and married to Julie. Together they have five children aged between 17 and 23, who are all studying. 

Nestor has been selling clothes for five years. This is his fourth loan from Turame. With his Kiva loan, he will increase his capital and buy a large quantity of clothes to resell in order to earn more. 

In the next few years, Nestor would like to start rearing large cattle (cows and pigs) and see his children study.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of clothes to resell in order to earn more.

loans.name: Giovana Miluska Del Carmen

texts.es:
Giovana tiene 19 años, vive en la ciudad de Imperial todos los días trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de bebidas gaseosas y cerveza, con este pequeño negocio puede tener ingreso para poder salir adelante y cada día se esfuerza mucho para lograrlo, por ello cree que le va bien.

Giovana esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio y de esta manera poder mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener una profesión”.
texts.en:
Giovana is 19 years old and lives in the city of Imperial. Every day she works in her small business selling fizzy drinks and beer. From this small business she is able to make an income to get on in life and she works hard every day to achieve this. She thinks this is why it is going well for her. 

Giovana is grateful to the Kiva lenders since with the help they have given her she will be able to buy stock for her business and so improve her income and carry on working towards her dream: to have a profession.

loans.use: to buy stock (beer).

loans.name: Bermet

texts.en:
Bermet is a first-year student at the American University of Central Asia in the department of European Studies. Here is her story:

“Kyrgyzstan is a young and sovereign country. Becoming and developing as an independent country for Kyrgyzstan is not easy process, because we have to learn many things for the first time. Today, we have to solve everything by ourselves, whereas before everything was solved by the Soviet Union Government. In overcoming difficulties, many economic, social, and legal mistakes were made and still are being made. Twenty years of independence is not a small term for developing a country. I am almost a contemporary of our young country.

Seeing failures in the implementation of goals of our country, I am really worried, but also sincerely happy for the success of our country. Many people go to other countries looking for earnings and a better life. Thanks to them, the main part of the population of our country is surviving and has come out of material and financial difficulties. Studying at AUCA, I am sure that only here I will get an excellent education and the best professional skills which will be useful in my future life. AUCA gives lots of opportunities to its students, one of which is Kiva loans. It is one of the best opportunities, because students are able to cover their tuition fees. I would like to apply for a Kiva loan, too. It will give me an opportunity to fully dedicate myself to my studies, rather than worrying about how to make money to cover my tuition.”

loans.use: To pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Maxkamjon

texts.ru: Махкамчон добродушный  мужчина в возрасте 30 лет. Он женат  и имеет троих детей. Махкамчон живёт со своей женой в небольшом доме в сельском посёлке. Он заботится о своей семье и делает всё возможное чтобы прокормить свою семью. Махкамчон работает в компании по производству напитков на должности оператора. Там он получает хороший доход, но его недостаточно, чтобы покрывать все нужды семьи. Поэтому Махкамчон занимается ещё и животноводством. У него имеется  земельная площадь, где он может пасти своих скот. На сегодня у него имеется несколько голов скота, но он желает увеличить поголовье своего скота. Жена Махкамчона помогает ухаживать и растить скот. Бизнес животноводства приносит хороший доход, поэтому Махкамчон хочет расширить этот бизнес, увеличив поголовье своего скота. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд, чтобы получить кредит на покупку скота. Махкамчон заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Makhkamjon is a warm-hearted fellow of 30. He is married and has three children. Makhkamjon lives with his family in a small house in a rural village. He cares about his family and does everything he can to keep them well-fed. He works as a call agent for a company that produces soft drinks. He earns a good income there, but it’s not enough to cover all of the family’s needs. So Makhkamjon does animal husbandry on the side. He has a plot of land where he can look after his animals. Currently he has several head of cattle, but he would like to increase their number. His wife helps him to look after and raise the cattle. The livestock business is lucrative, so Makhkamjon wants to expand this business by acquiring more animals.  He has turned to Arvnad to request a loan to buy a cow. Makhkamjon thanks Arvand in advance for its support.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom is 50 years old. She is widowed and resides with her mother and a twenty-year-old child in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a massage parlor for over three years, earning approximately $7 per day. Her child is a chef who makes an income of $4 daily. 

Due to a lack of funds, Mom is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase construction materials to fix her house. This money will help her provide a comfortable house for her family’s living. In the future, she would like to run an additional business and help her child earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to fix her house

loans.name: Sitha

texts.en:
Sitha is 46 years old. She is widowed and resides with her mother and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been selling fried noodles for more than a year, earning approximately $10 per day. Her children are employed. They make an income of $5 daily. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Sitha is requesting a loan of $1,400 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her reduce the family’s transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to run a pub and build a bathroom.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Qumriddin

texts.ru:
Кумриддин является фермером. Он занимается растениеводством еще с юных лет. А 7 лет назад Кумриддин обосновал свое дехканское хозяйство, которое состоит из 0,55 га орошаемого участка земли. На нем Кумриддин выращивает огородные культуры, в частности картофель, лук, морковь и т.д. Параллельно он еще и занимается животноводством. 
Кумриддину 36 лет. Он до сих пор не обзавелся семьей и проживает с матерью, отцом и братом в районе А.Джоми. Кумриддин очень трудолюбивый человек. Он все свое время посвящает своей деятельности. Сейчас Кумриддин как и многие фермеры готовится к очередному посеву. Он запрашивает кредит, чтобы купить семена картофеля, лука, моркови, а также минеральные удобрения и топливо. С полученной прибыли Кумриддин хочет в доме отремонтировать пол.
texts.en:
Qumridden is a farmer who has been  planting crops since he was young. Seven years ago he started his own farm on 0.55 hectares of irrigated land, where he plants vegetables such as potatoes, onions, carrots, and so forth. He also raises farm animals. 

Qumridden is 36 years old and does not have his own family yet, so he lives with his mother, father, and brother in the A. Jomi district. Qumridden is a hard-working man who devotes all of his time to his work. Like many other farmers, he is currently preparing for the next growing season. He has asked for a loan to buy seed potatoes, onion and carrot seeds, fertilizers and fuel. Qumridden wants to use his profits to renovate the floors in his house.

loans.use: to purchase seed potatoes, onion and carrot seeds, fertilizers and fuel.

loans.name: Jose Salvador

texts.es: José de 44 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos. José se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, responsable y visionario. Desde hace 20 años trabaja como albañil en diferentes zonas de su localidad ya que por su experiencia muchas personas solicitan sus servicios. Su vivienda es muy humilde construida a base de lámina la cual no está terminada. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada para terminar las paredes de su vivienda.
texts.en:
José is 44 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and their two children. José is a hard working, responsible and forward-looking man. He has worked as a bricklayer for 20 years in various places around the area since a lot of people want him to do work for them because of his experience. 

His home is very basic and is made of metal sheeting, but is unfinished. He is asking for this loan from FUSAI to buy galvanised metal sheeting so he can finish the walls of his house.

loans.use: to buy galvanised metal sheets to repair the walls of his home.

loans.name: Cerro Redondo Group

texts.es:
La señora Eblin Consuelo es casada. Tiene 40 años de edad. De esclaridad 4to. grado de educación primaria. Tiene 3 hijos y los 3 estan estudiando. Se dedica a la crianza de pollos. Inició este negocio juntamente con su esposo con un poco capital y a la fecha lleva 6 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de pollos para criarlos y luego venderlos. Desea en el futuro poder tener una granja.

Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio y a la crianza de animales de corral.

En la fotografía aparece dos persona más, pero a ellas ya no se le concedieron el préstamo, son esas personas que no ven muy bien en la foto.
texts.en:
Eblin Consuelo is married and is 40 years old. She has been educated up to the fourth grade of primary school. She has three children who are all studying. She works at raising chickens, and started this business with her husband, using a little capital. She now has six years of experience. Eblin organizes a group and is asking for a loan to buy chickens to raise and then sell. Her dream for the future is to be able to have a farm.

The other members of the group make their livings in trade and in rearing the birds in the yard.

There are 2 women who are not identifiable in the picture, and who were not awarded a loan.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Sorphorn

texts.en:
Sorphorn is 19 years old and single. He has a permanent address in Rolea Bíer district, Kampong Chhnang province where he lives with his parents and other siblings. Sorphorn just graduated from high school this year and got a scholarship to study at Mekong University with a special discount price, so he pays only USD 195 per year. His major is International Technology, a subject that he loves to study and is suitable for his personality. His education is subsidized by his parents; they are in the business of making and trading bamboo baskets into the local markets of the province.

Due to the family’s financial constraints, Sorphorn is experiencing difficulties paying his education fees, so he would like to acquire a loan amounting to 500 US dollars, which will be used to pay both for two-year tuition fees and non-tuition fees (studying materials). Sorphorn is very delighted and grateful for the loan funded via Kiva to allow poor students like him to pursue a higher education and contribute to the future development of Cambodia.

loans.use: to pay both for two-year tuition fees and non-tuition fees (studying materials).

loans.name: Saye's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 05 personnes fait partie du banc villageois de Sarèmes Sérères qui a été créé le 13 décembre 2008. Il est composé des membres qui vivent dans le village. Les membres sont solidaires et vivent dans la bonne entente. leurs principales activités sont le commerce et l'embouche.
Amy, habillé en bleu clair au centre de la photo est âgée de 48 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants dont 03 garçons. Avec le prêt, elle compte réinvestir dans son échoppe. Elle a ouvert une échoppe chez elle où elle vend des denrées de premières nécessités. Elle fait cette activité depuis bien longtemps et à une très bonne expérience dans ce domaine. Elle achète 02 sacs de 50 kg de riz à 12500 F qu'elle revend au détail à 275 F le Kg. 01 sac sucre de 50 Kg à 28 000 F le sac qu'elle revend à 600 F le kg. 02 bidons d'huile de 20 L à 16 500 le bidon, revendu à 900 F le Litre. 150 Kg de mil à 200 F le Kg vendu à 275 F le Kg. 04 Kg de café à 1600 F le Kg vendu à 50 F le gobelet. (Pour un Kg de café moulu on peut avoir à peu près 200 gobelets de café). 10 paquets de thé à 800 F le paquet (le paquet contient 10 boites) qu'elle revend à 100 F la boite. 1 Kg de piment à 2200 F vendu en sachets de 25, 50 ou 100 F. 1 Kg d'ail à 400 F vendu entre 50 et 100 F le sachet. 03 paquets de Maggi à 1250 F le paquet (01 paquet contient 50 tablettes) vendu à 30 F la tablette.
Avec les bénéfices réalisés, elle compte renforcer son épargne, payer ses intérêts et aussi participer aux frais scolaire de ses enfants et subvenir à ses propres besoins.
texts.en:
This group of five women is part of the Sarèmes Sérères banc villageois, which was set up on December 13, 2008. It is made up of members who live in the village, and the members are supportive of each other and get on well. Their main activities are trade and fattening cattle. 

Amy, pictured in light blue in the middle of the photo, is 48 years old. She is married and the mother of six children, three of whom are boys. Amy will use this loan to reinvest in her shop, which she runs from home, selling essential food items. She has been running this business for a long time and has a lot of experience in this area.

She buys two 50kg sacks of rice at 12 500 francs, which she resells to individuals at 275 francs a kilogram; one 50kg sack of sugar at 28 000 francs, which she resells at 600 francs a kilogram; two 20L cans of oil at 16 500 a can, which she resells at 900 francs a litre; 150kg of millet at 200 francs a kilogram, sold at 275 francs a kilogram; four kilograms of coffee at 1 600 francs a kilogram, sold at 50 francs a cup (one kilogram of ground coffee makes around 200 cups of coffee); 10 packets of tea at 800 francs a packet (each packet contains 10 boxes), which she resells at 100 francs a box; one kilogram of pepper at 2 200 francs, sold in packets for 25, 50 or 100 francs; one kilogram of garlic at 400 francs, sold for between 50 and 100 francs a sachet; 3 packets of Maggi condiments at 1 250 francs a packet (1 packet contains 50 cubes), sold at 30 francs a cube.

With the profits, she is hoping to increase her savings, pay off the interest, contribute to her children's school fees and provide for her own needs.

loans.use: to reinvest in her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an eco-friendly electric and hybrid car to use for transportation for her business

loans.name: Yesenia Yahoska

texts.es:
Yesenia de 21 años de edad, madre soltera con un hijo  de tres años de edad. Es originaria de Managua, lugar que está ubicada en la zona central de país. Esta joven mujer se caracteriza por ser responsable, trabajadora, con ganas de luchar en vida para poder  brindarle un futuro mejor a su pequeño hijo. En su ratos libre le gusta disfruta de la compañía de su pequeño y pasar tiempo de calidad. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde muy joven. Y en la actualidad con mucha más razón porque es madre y padre  para su pequeño.

Gracia a  su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de atol elaborado de maíz. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación y también lo desempeña de forma ambulante. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de materia prima para la elaboración del atol como maíz, canela, azúcar, vasos descartables, bolsas, leche, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Yesenia agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 21 years old and is a single mother with a 3-year-old son.  She is originally from Managua, which is located in the central region of her country.  This young mother is known for being responsible, hardworking, and for dedicating her life to helping offer a better future to her young son.  In her free time, she likes to enjoy the company of her son.

Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, she wasn't able to go to school and instead had to work starting at a very young age.  Currently, she has an even greater need to work because she is playing the roles of both mother and father to her little son.

Thanks to her efforts and desire to get ahead, she is able to work selling atol (a traditional, cornstarch-based drink).  She runs her business from her house and also sells as a street vendor.  The purpose of this loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business with raw materials that she will use to make atol.  These include corn, cinnamon, sugar, disposable cups, bags, and milk.  She hopes that with this loan she will soon be able to obtain greater profits.

Yesenia is thankful to Kiva lenders who help those with scant resources and who are from poor countries such as Nicaragua because it helps support them as they obtain respectable ways to support themselves.

loans.use: invest in working capital and buy raw materials for her business such as corn, cinnamon, sugar, disposable cups, bags, and milk.

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona is 37 years old and married.  She helps her husband operate a service-based business. 

Aside from this, she also has coco land, their main source of income. In 2008, Rona joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Her previous loans used in the transportation business were successfully repaid. 

Recently, she borrowed to purchase fertilizer and salt for the coco land.She wants to improve the general living situation of her entire family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and salt for her coco land

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 38 years of age, married to a farmer, and blessed with four children. She has managed a livestock business for almost five years.  In particular, she raises hogs, and she earns a net income every four months amounting to 2,000 PHP per hog. 

Due to financial constraints, she decided to take a loan amounting to 20,000 PHP to purchase hog feed to meet the needs of her hogs. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can use it in her business to earn more profits.

loans.use: To purchase hog feed to meet the needs of her hogs.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 36 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Gloria owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services.  Aside from this, she is also engaged in raising pigs for sale. In 2009, Gloria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid her previous loan used in the transportation business. 

Gloria requests a new loan to buy feed and piglets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Fazeelat

texts.en:
Fazeelat, a 46-year-old hardworking woman, lives in Lahore, Pakistan with her husband and five children. All of her children are studying in school, while her husband owns a small leather goods shop. He stitches a variety of leather bags and sells them in the market. 

Fazeelat has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase leather, rexine, zippers and threads for sewing bags, all materials that are  very important to the continued success of his business. As a result they will be able to increase their monthly income as well as savings. 

Fazeelat dreams of being able to provide the opportunity of higher education for her children. She is very much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for the help they are providing to her.

loans.use: to purchase leather, rexine, zippers and threads for sewing bags.

loans.name: Dilshoda

texts.ru: Дилшода трудолюбивая и очень дружелюбная женщина в возрасте 34 лет. Она замужем и имеет троих детей. Муж Дильшоды находится на заработках в России, там он работает строителем и каждый месяц присылает денежные средства своей семье. Сама Дильшода, чтобы помогать мужу приносить в дом доход, занимается животноводством. Она откармливает и выращивает скот, затем продаёт мясо и молоко, полученное от скота. Также в свободное время Дильшода шьёт женскую национальную одежду на заказ. Сейчас пришло время женить старшего сына, и Дильшода занимается организацией свадебного торжества. Ей необходимо закупить много вещей и подарков своему сыну. У неё есть накопленное сбережение, но его недостаточно, чтобы закупить всё необходимое. Поэтому Дильшода обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку приданного для свадьбы своего сына. Она очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за помощь.
texts.en: Dilshoda is a hardworking and friendly woman of 34. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia, where he works in construction and sends money home to his family each month. To bring in more money, Dilshoda is engaged in animal husbandry. She feeds and raises animals for their meat and milk. In her free time she works freelance, making traditional Tadjik clothing. The time has now come to marry off their eldest son, and Dilshoda is organizing the wedding.  She needs to buy all kinds of items and gifts for her son. She has some savings, but it is not enough to buy everything she needs. Therefore Dilshoda has turned to Arvand for a loan to buy a wedding dowery for her son. She has great hopes for success in this endeavor and thanks Arvand in advance for its help.

loans.use: buy a dowry for her son's wedding

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is 35 years old and a very poor and needy woman. The major reason for this is that her husband does not have a profitable job at this time. 

Her husband provides sheltering services to earn money to feed the whole family. When planks have broken and lost their smoothness, he replaces them with new ones. 

Her husband is unable to continue his business without new planks. Therefore, Naseem has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy new, smooth wooden boards, timbers, and bamboo to continue his business again. 

She hopes that this loan will bring positive changes in her life and that her husband will earn maximum profit with the help of this loan. 

Naseem is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy planks for her husband's repair service.

loans.name: Maria Felicitas

texts.es: María de 65 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su grupo familiar desde hace mucho tiempo. María es una mujer admirable ya que a pesar de su edad no se cansa de trabajar y luchar por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tamales en diferentes zonas de su comunidad. De esta forma colabora con la economía de su hogar. Desea mejorar  sus condiciones habitacionales por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación de las paredes de su vivienda y para la construcción de un servicio sanitario ya que se encuentra en malas condiciones. Con el crédito comprará lámina galvanizada, ladrillos, cemento, arena y tazas de servicio. Espera poder contar con este apoyo y así dar a su familia mejores condiciones habitacionales.
texts.en:
María is 65 years old has lived in her own house with her family for a long time.  María is an admirable woman since despite her age she doesn't tire of working and striving to improve her quality of life and that of her family.  She works making and selling tamales in different parts of her community.  In this way, she contributes to her household expenses.

She wants to improve her living situation and for this reason she is asking FUSAI for this loan.  She will use it to invest in fixing the walls of her house and installing indoor plumbing (since what she has now is in bad condition).  With this loan, she will buy sheet metal, bricks, cement, sand, and pay the laborers.  She hopes to receive this help and in this way give her family better living conditions.

loans.use: buy sheet metal, bricks, cement, sand, and pay laborers to fix the walls of her house and install indoor plumbing.

loans.name: Las Ganadoras 31 Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento LAS GANADORAS 31 está compuesta por diez integrantes siete mujeres y tres varones, todos ellos se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la señora Elizabeth tiene 34 años casada con dos hijitos de la edad de 8 y 13 años, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa según la temporada, ella vende sus productos en distintas ferias de la ciudad de la Paz, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la señora Elizabeth va a usar este préstamo para compra de ropa según la temporada al por mayor y asi surtir su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar su mercadería, la señora Elizabeth enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando  mercadería y así de esta manera genera más ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
" LAS GANADORAS 31"  communal bank is composed of 10 members, seven women and three men. They all have different businesses. The president of the communal bank is Elizabeth. She is 34 years old, is married and has two children aged 8 and 13. She sells clothing according to the season. She sells her product in the various markets of the city of La Paz.

This is Elizabeth's second loan with the institution. She will use the loan to buy seasonal clothing wholesale to stock her business. The reason she is requesting this loan is to increase her merchandise. Elizabeth's challenges in her business are her competition. She will use the profit to continue buying merchandise and in this way generate more revenues.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Bersabas Trinidad

texts.es:
Bersabas de 32 años de edad, casado con tres hijos menores de edad de 14,10,8 anos. Es originario de Managua. El se caracteriza por ser un padre trabajador, responsable con sus pequeños. Que a pesar de todas las adversidades que se le han presentado en el camino no pierde las ganas, ni el positivismo de luchar y seguir adelante que como padres tiene una gran motivación que son sus hijos.  Lamentablemente el no pudo estudiar, y que desde muy joven se dedico a trabajar para ganarse el pan de cada día.
Gracia a sus ganas de salir adelante, el tiene por actividad económica el servicio de una caponera, el cual es un medio de transporte y es muy demandado por las personas de los mercados y los pobladores de su comunidad. El dedica su negocio unas 10 horas diarias, ofreciendo sus servicios a clientes fijos y eventuales. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y darle mantenimiento a su medio de transporte como es la compra de llantas nuevas, y pintar la caponera. Bersabas agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es  Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Bersabas is 32 years old and is married with 3 young children aged 14, 10 and 8 years. He originally comes from Managua. He is a hard working father who takes responsibility for his young children. In spite of all the adversity which has come his way he hasn't lost the will and the drive to make progress in life and as a father he has his children as his motivation. Unfortunately he wasn't able to go to school and had to work from a very young age to put food on the table every day. 

Thanks to his desire to make progress in life, Bersabas runs a 'caponera' service, which is a mode of transport [motorbike taxi] and is in great demand with people in the markets and those who live in his community. He works for 10 hours a day, offering his services to regular and occasional customers. 

The purpose of the loan is to have working capital and to carry out maintenance on his means of transport such as fitting new tyres and painting the motorbike taxi. Bersabas is grateful for the help which the Kiva lenders provide to people of limited means in poor countries such as Nicaragua so they can have a decent job.

loans.use: to have working capital and carry out maintenance on his means of transport, buying new tyres and painting the motorbike taxi.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben wants to work in the petroleum industry. Ruben is currently attending the Universidad Mayor de San Andrés, working towards his degree in mining engineering. He plans on graduating in July, 2014 but without a loan from Vittana he fears that he will need to defer his graduation. With this loan, Ruben plans on paying his graduation fee. This fee is often more expensive than the semester's tuition and is a frequent impediment for graduating students in El Alto. 

With a degree in mining engineering, Ruben expects to earn $30 a day. Unfortunately, Ruben's parents never had the opportunity to complete their high school education and without the opportunity for a higher degree, his parents never had the chance to move up. As Ruben grew up, finances were always tight. With three siblings Ruben is unsure how he will be able to finance his education on his own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan. Ruben's father's salary from his job as a policeman is the family's primary source of income.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees

loans.name: Olga Sofia

texts.es:
La señora Olga es una persona muy honesta y responsable, vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Su negocio es una pulpería desde hace 10 años, ubicada en su comunidad la cual es muy visitada y conocida por los vecinos de la misma.
Doña Olga está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de más productos como ser: maíz, manteca, huevos, queso, refrescos, churros, arroz, frijoles, pan, café, mantequilla, carne, jugos, etc. que necesita para surtir más de producto su negocio.
Doña Olga espera que el préstamo le sirva de mucha ayuda ya que gracias a el contara con los insumos necesarios para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y así mismo satisfacer las necesidades de estos, de igual manera espera que sus ventas tengan un aumento y gracias a este ganar más ingresos que beneficien el estilo de vida de la familia en el hogar.
Doña Olga espera aumentar su negocio y seguir apoyando a su familia para que cumplan sus metas y sueños.


Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre 2013
texts.en:
Olga is honest and responsible. She lives in a town in southern Honduras with her husband and two children. She has operated her small, local grocery shop for 10 years, and her neighbors know her well. Olga has applied for a loan to buy more merchandise like corn, margarine, eggs, cheese, beverages, churros, rice, beans, bread, coffee, butter, meat, and juices for her business. 

Olga expects the loan to be helpful in stocking the supplies necessary to meet customer demand, increasing her sales, and earning more money to improve her family's standard of living. Olga hopes to grow her business and keep helping her family meet its goals and dreams. 

Choluteca, Honduras – October 2013

loans.use: to buy corn, margarine, eggs, cheese, beverages, churros, rice, beans, bread, coffee, butter, meat, juices, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Alba Marina

texts.es:
La señora Alba es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad en el  sur de Honduras junto con ella viven sus 3 hijos. Su negocio es una mini pulpería desde hace 5 años, la cual es muy visitada por los vecinos de su comunidad.
Doña Alba está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de más producto como ser: refrescos, manteca, pan, huevos, pollo, azúcar, café, churros, carne, embutidos, arroz, frijoles, etc. que necesita para cubrir la demanda de producto que tiene de sus clientes.
Doña Alba espera que el préstamo le sirva de mucho y que gracias a esto contar con los insumos  suficientes para  cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y así satisfacer los pedidos de los mismos, de tal manera que sus ventas tengan un gran aumento, con el cual pueda ganar más ingresos que beneficien su estilo de vida y el de su familia en el hogar.
Doña Alba su sueño es su negocio siga creciendo y que se convierta en el mas conocido de la comunidad y  así seguir apoyando a su familia y cumplir las metas y sueños de sus hijos como el de que estos terminen sus estudios.


Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre 2013
texts.en:
Alba is hardworking and responsible. She lives in a town in southern Honduras with her three children. She has owned a small grocery store for five years that her neighbors shop at regularly. Alba has applied for a loan to buy more merchandise like beverages, margarine, bread, eggs, chicken, sugar, coffee, churros, meat, canned goods, rice, beans, and more to meet customer demand.

Alba hopes the loan will help her buy enough merchandise to satisfy her customers and fill their orders so that her sales and income increase enough to improve her family's standard of living. Alba dream is to grow her business, making it the best known in her neighborhood, and to keep helping her family achieve its goals and her children their dreams, such as finishing their education.

Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre 2013

loans.use: to buy beverages, margarine, bread, eggs, chicken, sugar, coffee, churros, meat, canned goods, rice, beans, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Kholbi

texts.ru: Эту 50-летнюю предприимчивую женщину зовут Холби. Она живет со своей семьей в районе Шахритус. Холби в течение 20 лет держит в доме крупнорогатый скот, мясо и молочные продукты которых используется для хозяйственных нужд семьи. За коровами Холби ухаживает сама. Она каждый день кормит, поит и доит их. Холби решила превратить свое любимое дело в бизнес. Она хочет начать бизнес по купле и продаже крупнорогатого скота. Начальный капитал Холби составляет 400 долларов, а также имеется большой коровник. Чтобы закупить бычков ей не хватает еще 1800 долларов США. Эту сумму она запрашивает в кредит. Холби планирует купить 4-х голов бычка, откармливать их в течение 30 дней и затем с наценкой продавать на местном скотном рынке. Открыв новый бизнес, Холби будет получать хорошую прибыль и финансовое положение ее семьи намного улучшится.
texts.en:
This 50-year-old adventurous woman is called Kholbi. She lives with her family in the Shahrituz region. Over the course of 20 years, Kholbi has been keeping at home cattle, meat and dairy products that she uses for the household needs of the family. Kholbi cares for the cows herself. Every day, she gives them feed and water, and milks them. 

Kholbi decided to turn her favorite activity into a business. She wants to start a business buying and selling cattle. Kholbi's starting capital consists of US$400, а также имеется большой коровник. Чтобы закупить бычков ей не хватает еще US$1,800. She is requesting this sum as a loan. 

Kholbi plans to buy four head of steer, to fatten them over the course of 30 days and then with a premium to sell them at the local livestock market. Opening a new business, Kholbi will get a good income and the financial position of her family will be much improved.

loans.use: to purchase four steer to start a business raising and selling cattle

loans.name: Yarann

texts.en:
Yarann is 61 years old. He is married and resides with five children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. 

He and his wife have been selling porridge, fried noodles, and rice for more than four years, earning about USD 7 per day. Four of his children are employed. They earn about USD 20 each day. 

Due to a lack of funds, Yarann is requesting a loan of USD 1,500 to buy construction materials to fix his house. This money will help him provide better living conditions for the family. 

In the future, he would like to expand his business and help his youngest child earn higher education.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to fix his house

loans.name: Roeung

texts.en:
Roeung is 23 years old and a single, living with his parents in Kep province. Roeung currently works for an organization and has a normal salary of USD 80 per month. 

However, his earnings are not enough to pay his tuition fees at the university, so his education is subsidized by his parents. Roeung is now a second-year student, majoring in law at Cambodia University for Specialties, located in Kampot province.

At the beginning of each academic year, Roeung experiences financial difficulties to cover his education costs. To help address this issue, Roeung has applied for a loan of USD 500, which will be used to pay his tuition fees. 

Roeung is very delighted and grateful for the loan funded via a program like Kiva to allow poor student like him to pursue a higher education and contribute to the future development of Cambodia. 

This loan will be disbursed over several years and paid directly to the educational institution at the time of enrollment fees for each academic year.  Accordingly, there is the possibility of a small variation in loan amount and repayment terms, based on shifting class availability and prices.  

Kiva lenders will be notified with a journal update in the event of any future changes to the loan terms.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees.

loans.name: Lezel

texts.en:
Lezel works hard to support her family. She is married, and she has a business buying and selling mangoes in the Philippines.

Lezel has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more mangoes to sell in her mango stall.

Lezel has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more mangoes to sell in her mango stall

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 57 years old, married, and has two children. She earns a living from her pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Aida is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Aida has been in pig fattening for one year and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her business.

Roselyn has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from a general store.

Roselyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 38 years old, married, and has one child who is in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Raquel requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Raquel has been raising pigs for eight years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. Raquel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Janet is 39 years old, and has three children who are still in school.

Janet buys and sells mangoes for business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more mangoes to sell. Janet has been in this business for four years. In the future, Janet would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more mangoes to sell.

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es: Luis es un campesino de 34 años de edad que, durante su vida productiva se ha dedicado a trabajar en el campo lechero, inicialmente trabajó en diferentes empresas lecheras y, con el paso del tiempo tuvo la oportunidad de independizarse y comenzar a generar ingresos por cuenta propia; hoy en día posee 12 vacas productoras de leche cuyo producto es vendido diariamente a una de las empresas del sector lechero más grandes del país; de esta manera genera los recursos suficientes para llevar el sustento a su familia, conformada por su esposa y dos hijos. Su empuje, tenacidad y dedicación le han permitido salir adelante, sobrepasando los grandes desafíos que la vida le pone, especialmente ocasionados por los altos costos de los insumos agrícolas con los que cuida a sus animales; sin embargo, esto no lo detiene en su andar. Solicita el apoyo del crédito con el único interés de comprar 2 vacas productoras de leche más para aumentar su ganado, lo que le permitirá ampliar la producción de líquido para poder vender más producto y así mejorar los ingresos que recibe diariamente. De esta forma Luis quiere seguir luchando por alcanzar sus metas y sueños, especialmente el de llegar a tener mínimo 20 vacas para aprovechar el espacio que tiene disponible en la finca que arrienda, esto le permitirá hacer de su actividad un negocio más rentable y podrá brindar a su familia una estabilidad económica favorable para disfrutar de un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis, 34, is a farmer who has spent his working life in the dairy business. He initially worked for some dairy companies but took the chance to go out on his own and earn money for himself. He now has 12 dairy cows, and he sells the milk daily to one of the country's largest dairy businesses. He is able to earn enough money to provide for his family, which comprises his wife and two children. His effort, tenacity, and dedication have allowed him to prosper and overcome the biggest challenges life presented, especially during times when supplies to take care of his livestock were very expensive.

He has applied for a loan to buy two milk cows to increase his herd. This will let him produce more milk to sell and increase his daily earnings. Luis wants to keep striving to achieve his goals and dreams, especially to have a minimum of 20 cows so that he use all the available space on the farm he rents. His business would then be more profitable, and he would be able to offer his family greater financial stability, greater well being, and a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy two milk cows.

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira is a 26-year-old married woman. Her financial condition is not good. She has to think many times to start any task. Her husband has recently started to drive a moto rickshaw (a type of three-wheeled rickshaw using a motorbike). This rickshaw is driven over local roads and for small distances. Its body is made of a material that is not strong enough to bear jerks over roads. Now the rickshaw body needs to be replaced because it is rattling during driving. This is the reason he wants to buy a new body for his moto rickshaw.

Sumaira requested a loan so that her husband can maintain the rickshaw body so that it will drive smoothly. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a moto rickshaw body.

loans.name: Ramzana

texts.en:
Ramzana is a 45-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband, two daughters, and four sons in Punjab, Pakistan. 

Since 2007, her husband has had a general store, and he works very hard to meet his family's needs. He sells a variety of goods that include sugar, rice, ice cream, candies, biscuits, etc.

He needs additional capital for the growth of his business. His wife Ramzana has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. 

With the loan money, her husband can buy a variety of goods for his general store, such as sugar, rice, and tea packs, to satisfy his clients more professionally, as well as to increase his savings for the better future of his children.

Ramzana and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family.

loans.use: To buy a variety of goods for her husband's general store, such as sugar, rice, and tea packs

loans.name: Karla Teresa

texts.en:
Karla dreams of becoming a doctor but without a degree knows it may never be possible. Karla is currently attending the Universidad Latinoamericana de Medicina, working towards her degree in medicine. She plans on graduating in December, 2013 but without a loan from Vittana she thinks that she may need to take time off to work and save until she can return to school. Karla plans on using the loan to cover the cost of her graduation fees. Often there are fees for earning your title in medicine before graduating. 

In addition to her responsibilities at school, Karla currently works 30 hours a week and earns $15 a day. With a degree in medicine she expects to earn $25 a day. With four siblings, Karla is unsure how she will be able to pay her graduation fee on her own without the assistance of a Vittana loan.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees.

loans.name: Soda's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 18 personnes fait partie du Banc villageois qui a été créé le 12 décembre 2009. Il est composé de membres qui entretiennent de très bonnes relations.
